0.title: 27-year-old woman sexually assaulted by man near bus stop in Pune
0.article_body: A case has been filed after a 27-year-old woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by a man near Chakan bus stop in Pune. The woman, who'd left her house after a fight with her live-in partner,  was sleeping with her minor son in the bus stop's night guard's room when the accused pulled her out and sexually assaulted her, police said.

1.title: Twitter CEO Parag set to receive $42 mn if terminated after Musk's takeover: Reports
1.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal would get an estimated $42 million if he is terminated within 12 months of a change in control at the social media company, according to reports quoting research firm Equilar. Musk in a securities filing had said he did not have confidence in Twitter's management. Musk has struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

2.title: Intention was to kill: Police in Shahdara gang-rape case charge-sheet
2.article_body: Delhi Police filed charge-sheet in Shahdara gang-rape case and said the crime was committed with the intention of killing the victim, a 20-year-old woman, and taking revenge for a minor's death. "The minor died by suicide in November 2021...his family blamed the victim for it," police added. The woman was gang-raped and paraded with a blackened face on January 26.

3.title: Home guard saves woman from slipping under moving local train in Mumbai
3.article_body: An alert home guard deployed on a suburban local train in Mumbai saved a woman from falling into the gap between the train and the platform. The woman, who lost balance after landing on the platform while deboarding the moving train, continued to hold onto the train. She was pulled ahead as train began to gain momentum.

4.title: Involve children in sports else they will be engaged on screen: SC
4.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday sought the response of the Centre and states to a petition that asked to make sports or physical literacy a fundamental right under the Constitution. Dealing with the petition, the bench said, “Children involved in sports will be something very useful, otherwise they will end up spending time on screen (gadgets).”

5.title: Man says boys smoking ganja in temple ground, Mumbai Police responds
5.article_body: A Twitter user, in his tweet, said that some young boys were smoking ganja in a temple ground in Mumbai's Malvani. "[They are] fighting with locals when they tried to stop them from sitting," the tweet said. Mumbai Police replied to him saying they have informed the main control room about the issue.

6.title: I want to make Twitter better than ever: Musk after $44 bn takeover deal finalised
6.article_body: Elon Musk, after finalising his $44 billion Twitter buyout deal, said, "I want to make Twitter better than ever by enhancing the product with new features." He added that he looks to make Twitter better by "making the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeating the spam bots, and authenticating all humans". He added, "Twitter has tremendous potential."

7.title: Free speech bedrock of functioning democracy: Musk as Twitter accepts buyout offer
7.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk said, "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy," after Twitter accepted his offer to take the social media company private for approximately $44 billion. He added, "Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated." Musk will buy each Twitter share for $54.20 in cash.

8.title: Twitter impacts the entire world: CEO Parag as Musk bags deal to buy Twitter
8.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal took to Twitter after the world's richest man Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter was accepted by the social media company's board. "Twitter has a purpose and relevance that impacts the entire world," tweeted Agrawal. He added, "Deeply proud of our teams and inspired by the work that has never been more important."

9.title: Elon Musk to buy Twitter for $44 billion
9.article_body: Twitter has accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company. It entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by an entity wholly owned by Musk, for $54.20 per share in cash in a transaction valued at approximately $44 billion. Upon completion of the transaction, Twitter will become a privately held company.

10.title: Chandigarh makes masks mandatory in closed environment
10.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Monday made the wearing of masks compulsory in closed environments including public spaces, public transport and educational institutions amid a COVID-19 surge. The administration also stated that non-compliance with the order would invite a fine of ₹500. Chandigarh on Monday reported nine new COVID-19 cases, taking the city's total tally to 92,007 cases.

11.title: PBKS end their 2-match losing streak, hand CSK their 6th defeat in IPL 2022
11.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) defeated Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 11 runs in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. With this, PBKS ended their two-match losing streak and jumped to the sixth position on the points table, while CSK have now lost six matches in the tournament. PBKS' Shikhar Dhawan top-scored in the match with 88*(59).

12.title: Not right to cancel 23 passenger trains: Chhattisgarh CM
12.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel asked the Centre to reconsider the decision of halting the rail operations of 23 passenger trains. The upgradation work passing through the state is the reason for the halting of the South East Central Railway divisions. "It is not right to cancel passenger trains at this time because summer vacations are approaching," the CM said.

13.title: No alternative to TRS in Telangana, Opposition is hopeless: KTR
13.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) working President KT Rama Rao said that there is no alternative to the TRS in Telangana for the next year's state Assembly elections. "We have worked hard and delivered on the promises we made. The Opposition has been hopeless," he said. "I believe there's no Opposition to TRS," he added.

14.title: SC stays action on slum dwellers in Sarojini Nagar till next week
14.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday directed not to take any coercive action against slum dwellers of the Sarojini Nagar area of New Delhi until further orders. The SC told Additional Solicitor General (ASG) KM Nataraj, who appeared for the Centre, "Deal with them humanely...You can't say you won't have the policy to rehabilitate and simply throw them away."

15.title: 16, including a Bangladeshi, arrested in Assam for terror links
15.article_body: Assam Police arrested 16 people including one Bangladeshi terrorist from different parts of the state as they all had links with terrorist groups, Ansarul Bangla Team and Al-Qaida Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). “Out of them, one named Md Suman alias Saiful Islam hailing from Bangladesh's Narayanganj is the kingpin. He escaped from Bangladesh,” Additional Director General of Police, Hiren Nath said.

16.title: BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of PM Modi's govt
16.article_body: To mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government, a team of 12 senior BJP leaders met on Monday, to plan a big outreach programme. To celebrate the occasion, grand programmes will be organised all over the country. The meeting included Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP general secretaries among others.

17.title: India, Russia in talks to restart coking coal supplies: Report
17.article_body: Indian and Russian officials held talks in New Delhi last week where Russia urged India to move forward with their last year's deal on coking coal imports, Reuters reported. Since March, Russian coal supply to India has stopped amid Western sanctions. Meanwhile, India's top coking coal supplier Australia has raised its prices from $200 to $700 per tonne.

18.title: Meghan might leave Harry, their marriage will end badly: Donald Trump
18.article_body: Ex-US President and former reality TV star Donald Trump has claimed that Meghan Markle's marriage to Prince Harry "will end and it will end [badly]". He also claimed that she might leave Harry "when she decides that she likes some other guy better". "Poor Harry is being led around by his nose. And I think he's an embarrassment," said Trump.

19.title: Russell's shot makes a hole in chair during net practice; KKR shares video
19.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) Andre Russell's shot broke a chair while the all-rounder was batting at the nets. KKR's official Instagram account shared a video of the incident and wrote, "Wait for the #MuscleRussell impact at the end!" The Windies all-rounder is the second-highest run-scorer from the KKR in the ongoing edition of the IPL.

20.title: CSK know how to bring their A-game when the business end arrives: Jaffer
20.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said defending champions CSK can certainly make a comeback with the way they won their two matches in the ongoing IPL so far. He added that CSK have many experienced players in their side who have won IPL in the past and they know how to bring their A-game when the business end arrives.

21.title: You can't help but give him another go: Pollock on MI's Shokeen
21.article_body: Ex-South Africa skipper Shaun Pollock praised MI debutant Hrithik Shokeen, saying he's impressed with the 21-year-old spinner. He added that MI can't help it but give him another chance as he was impressive on his IPL debut against CSK. Shokeen posted bowling figures of 4-0-23-0. He retained his place in the team for MI's next game against LSG.

22.title: Pic of PBKS' Rishi Dhawan wearing face guard while bowling goes viral, fans react
22.article_body: PBKS all-rounder Rishi Dhawan was seen wearing a face guard while bowling against CSK. Sharing a picture on Instagram, IPL wrote, "Well...this is new. What do you reckon of this bowling gear?" "Good innovation for safety," a fan commented. Another wrote, "Hoping that Rishi wearing a face shield can be a beginning...revolution regarding bowlers being more proactive with their safety."

23.title: Musk's Boring Company to start testing Hyperloop at full-scale this year
23.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's The Boring Company will begin testing high-speed transport system Hyperloop at full-scale later this year. Earlier today, Musk tweeted, "In the coming years, Boring Company will attempt to build a working Hyperloop." He noted that Hyperloop would be the fastest way of getting from one city centre to another for distances less than 3,220 km.

24.title: We know how to crush 'Dadagiri': Maha CM on Hanuman Chalisa issue
24.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has reacted to the Hanuman Chalisa controversy and said, "It's being said that we've ignored Hindutva. Is Hindutva a dhoti or what? Our Hindutva is 'Gada Dhari' like Lord Hanuman's Gada." He added, "If you want to recite Hanuman Chalisa, call and come home. But if you resort to 'Dadagiri', we know how to crumble it."

25.title: Housing prices may sustainably rise 8% this fiscal: India Ratings
25.article_body: India Ratings and Research on Monday said housing prices are expected to rise by 8% this fiscal mainly due to a rise in demand. "The price hike will be sustainable and is likely to be incremental. Prices were up 6% pan-India in FY22," the agency said. It expects the affordable housing segment to continue claiming around 50% of total sales.

26.title: Authoritarians are threat to comedy, art, music, poetry: Jon Stewart
26.article_body: Comedian Jon Stewart received Mark Twain Prize for American Humor on Sunday. While receiving the award, Jon said the "fragility of leaders" is the threat to comedy and not the "fragility of audiences". "When society is under threat, comedians are the ones who get sent away first...Authoritarians are...threat to comedy, to art, to music, to thought, to poetry," he added.

27.title: West trying to murder Russian journalists: Putin amid Ukraine war
27.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday accused West of plotting murders of Russian journalists amid Ukraine war, an allegation Kyiv has denied. Putin claimed that Russia's Federal Security Service had thwarted murder attempt by "terrorist group" on journalist Vladimir Solovyev. He made the remarks while interacting with prosecutors, demanding them to take a tough line against 'foreign spies'.

28.title: RBI imposes ₹1.12 crore penalty on Bank of Maharashtra
28.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India said it has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.12 crore on Bank of Maharashtra for non-compliance. As per RBI, the non-compliance is related to certain directions under KYC. The state-run bank failed to allot Unique Customer Identification Codes to its individual customers and to review the outsourcing arrangement for an outsourced financial service, RBI added.

29.title: Centre should make rules about loudspeakers: Maharashtra minister
29.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Monday said that "the Centre should make rules regarding loudspeakers at the national level, then the problem arising in the states will not take place." He along with Environment Minister Aditya Thackeray held a presser to discuss the state's law and order situation. The statement comes amid the loudspeaker controversy in Maharashtra.

30.title: India buys twice as much Russian oil in 2 months than in 2021: Report
30.article_body: India has bought over twice the amount of crude oil from Russia in the last two months than it did in entire 2021, Reuters reported. As per the report, Indian refiners have placed orders for at least 40 million barrels of Russian oil since Ukraine's invasion on February 24. Russia is selling oil at steep discounts amid Western sanctions.

31.title: The rawness that Irrfan had, Babil carries that: 'Qala' producer
31.article_body: 'Qala' producer Karnesh Ssharma in an interview has stated that late veteran actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil carries the same rawness that the former had. Babil will make his Bollywood debut with 'Qala' alongside actress Tripti Dimri. "A humble request would be to let him express himself and enjoy what he has done, rather than putting pressure," Karnesh added.

32.title: Yes Bank files insolvency plea against Zee over ₹468 cr default
32.article_body: Yes Bank has moved the National Company Law Tribunal seeking to initiate corporate insolvency proceedings against Zee Learn, claiming a default of ₹468 crore. As per Zee Learn, it received a notice from the Mumbai bench of the NCLT over Yes Bank's petition on Monday. It is in the process of compiling information to verify the facts, the company added.

33.title: 192.74 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses given to states & UTs: Govt
33.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare informed that more than 192.74 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been provided to the states and Union Territories to date by the Centre. The Government of India has been providing the states and UTs with free COVID-19 vaccines. The nationwide vaccination drive began on January 16, 2021.

34.title: Air India loses preferential access to int'l traffic rights
34.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) dropped a clause that gave the former national carrier, Air India, preferential access to international traffic rights over private airlines. As per the revised circular, the government may now grant or deny allocation of traffic rights to any airline based on its "preparedness" and "viability" of operations on a route, among other factors.

35.title: LIC IPO to open on May 4 and close on May 9: Reports
35.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of Life Insurance Corporation of India will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, reports said on Monday. The IPO, through which the government will sell a 3.5% stake in the state-owned firm, is expected to fetch ₹21,000 crore to the exchequer. The IPO size was scaled down from 5% earlier.

36.title: Veranda Learning to buy 30-yr-old test prep firm T.I.M.E. for ₹287 crore
36.article_body: Edtech company Veranda Learning on Monday said it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire T.I.M.E. (Advanced Educational Activities Pvt Ltd) for ₹287 crore. The acquisition will be conducted in two phases, 80% in the first phase, and the remaining 20% at the end of two years. Established in 1992, T.I.M.E. is a leading test-prep chain with a pan-India presence.

37.title: Ajay Devgn turns rapper for 'Runway 34' song 'Jalaya Toh Nahin'
37.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has collaborated with musician Yashraj Mukhate to rap in song 'Jalaya Toh Nahin' for his upcoming film 'Runway 34'. Yashraj shared the video on Instagram, writing, "This was sooo much fun!! @ajaydevgn sir doing a rap section for the first time in a track that I made. Isn't that insane?" The film also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

38.title: Director Om Raut, Abhishek Bachchan in talks for a project: Report
38.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut is reportedly in talks with actor Abhishek Bachchan for his upcoming project. A source quoted by Pinkvilla said, "It's in the action-drama space...Om feels that Abhishek fits the part to the T...the actor has liked the subject too." "However, the conversations are still at the nascent stage," the source added.  Abhishek was recently seen in 'Dasvi'.

39.title: No hope from PM Modi's Jammu visit: Mehbooba Mufti
39.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said her party did not see any hope in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's speech in Jammu. "He (PM) comes to visit Jammu and Kashmir, which he left no stone unturned to destroy. Our rights have been snatched. We have been reduced from a state to a Union Territory," she said.

40.title: Didn't mean to incite religious tensions: Navneet Rana to Om Birla
40.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana wrote to Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla saying that she wanted to "rekindle the flame of Hindutva in Shiv Sena" and didn't "mean to incite religious tensions" by chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. Rana also stated that she invited Thackeray to chant Hanuman Chalisa adding that her actions were not against him.

41.title: TMC will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam, form govt in 2026: Bora
41.article_body: Newly-appointed Trinamool Congress (TMC) Assam unit chief Ripun Bora asserted on Monday that the party will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam and form the government in 2026 state Assembly polls. He claimed that residents of Assam will embrace TMC as it's the only opposition party in the state. Bora resigned from Congress and joined TMC on April 17.

42.title: I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter: Elon Musk
42.article_body: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter, because that is what free speech means." His tweet came after several reports claimed that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer to buy the company. Republicans cheered the potential Twitter deal, hoping the former US President Donald Trump will return to Twitter.

43.title: Salman Khan to begin shooting for 'Kabhi Eid...' on May 15: Report
43.article_body: Salman Khan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' on May 15. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, the shooting will take place in Mumbai. "Farhad Samji (director) has already begun work on the pre-production formalities, and is excited to start filming," the source added. Actress Pooja Hegde will also feature in the film.

44.title: Strengthening ties with India a priority in upcoming decades: EU chief
44.article_body: Speaking at the seventh edition of Raisina Dialogue, European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said that for European Union (EU), prioritising and energising ties with India is a priority in the upcoming decades. "As vibrant democracies, India-EU share fundamental values and common interests...Both the economies thrive in the world of common rules in a fair competition," she added.

45.title: Depp heard calling Amber ‘fat a**’ and ‘c***’ in recordings played during trial
45.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp was heard calling ex-wife Amber Heard "fat a**" and "c***" in recordings of their arguments played in court during his defamation suit trial on Monday. In one of the clips, Heard, who has accused Depp of abuse, reportedly screamed and told Depp to "put his cigarettes out on someone else". Depp denied committing the alleged act.

46.title: Meta to open its first physical retail store in US next month, Zuckerberg shares pics
46.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Instagram to share that the company will open its first physical retail space, called 'Meta Store', on May 9. The 1,550 sq ft storefront is situated on Meta's campus in Burlingame, California. The store will let customers "get hands-on experience" with its Portal videophones, Ray-Ban Stories smart glasses and Quest 2 virtual reality headsets.

47.title: Musk tweets 'And be my love in the rain' amid reports of Twitter takeover deal
47.article_body: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "And be my love in the rain." His tweet came after several reports said that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43-billion takeover offer. Responding to Musk's tweet, Dogecoin's co-creator tweeted, "The birds have less to say for themselves...In the wood-world's torn despair...Than now these numberless years the elves...Although they are no less there."

48.title: Will Smith in India to meet Sadhguru over Oscars controversy: Report
48.article_body: Actor Will Smith is visiting India to meet Sadhguru following the controversy at the 2022 Oscars when he slapped comedian Chris Rock, as per reports. The actor was spotted at a private airport in Mumbai in his first public appearance since the incident. He had earlier apologised to Chris in an Instagram post. The Academy banned Will for ten years.

49.title: Prashant Kishor hasn't said if he's joining Congress: KT Rama Rao
49.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) KT Rama Rao reacted to speculations of poll strategist Prashant Kishor's induction to Congress, stating that Kishor hadn't confirmed if he was joining party. Rao earlier called Congress a "redundant institution", adding that TRS has no ties with it. Notably, TRS has hired Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign in 2023 state Assembly polls.

50.title: Eveready Industries reports ₹38.41 crore loss in Q4 FY22
50.article_body: Eveready Industries on Monday reported consolidated net loss of ₹38.41 crore in the January-March quarter. The company had posted net loss of ₹442.53 crore in Q4 FY21, it said in a regulatory filing. Its revenue from operations in Q4 FY22 rose 17.82% YoY from ₹249.81 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹294.33 crore while its total expenses stood at ₹241.23 crore.

51.title: Shikhar Dhawan crosses 6,000 IPL runs, 9,000 T20 runs in his 200th IPL match
51.article_body: Playing in his 200th IPL match, Punjab Kings (PBKS) opener Shikhar Dhawan on Monday crossed 6,000 runs in IPL and 9,000 runs in T20 cricket. He became the second batter after Virat Kohli to score 6,000 runs in IPL history. Dhawan is the third Indian after Kohli and Rohit Sharma to score 9,000 runs in T20 cricket.

52.title: Kishan has struggled a bit in IPL 2022, will talk to him soon: Jayawardena
52.article_body: Speaking about Ishan Kishan, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said the opener has been struggling with his form "a little", adding that he'll have a conversation with him soon. Kishan has scored 199 runs in eight IPL 2022 matches so far, including two fifties in the first two matches. Kishan was bought by MI for ₹15.25 crore in mega auction.

53.title: All schools closed in Odisha till April 30 in view of heatwave conditions
53.article_body: All government and private schools in Odisha will remain closed for five days starting April 26 (Tuesday) in view of the heatwave predicted there. However, scheduled examinations by the Odisha board of secondary education and council of higher education will continue. As many as 27 places in the state recorded a maximum temperature of 40°C or above on Monday.

54.title: Charge us with sedition for reciting Hanuman Chalisa: Fadnavis
54.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he'll chant the Hanuman Chalisa everyday and dared the Maharashtra government to charge him with sedition. Referring to the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and MLA Ravi Rana, Fadnavis said, "Will Hanuman Chalisa be recited in Pakistan, if not Maharashtra? The way Navneet and Ravi were treated is condemnable. What was their crime?"

55.title: Britney Spears announces she's taking short break from social media
55.article_body: Taking to Instagram, singer Britney Spears has said that she will be taking a short break from social media amid her pregnancy. "I'm going on a social media hiatus for a little while!!! I send my love and God bless you all," Britney wrote. She shared a video of a baby wearing sunglasses and sitting on a chair.

56.title: CSK will be very successful under Ravindra Jadeja: Rayudu
56.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu has said the franchise will be very successful under their new captain Ravindra Jadeja. The 33-year-old took over as the skipper of CSK after MS Dhoni relinquished captaincy in March. "He [Jadeja] has it in him to not only lead CSK but also India one day," he added. CSK are currently ninth in IPL 2022 standings.

57.title: No 'political twist' in Bihar, RJD not aligned with BJP, allies: Tejashwi
57.article_body: Reacting to speculations about 'political re-alignment' in Bihar after CM Nitish Kumar attended a Rashtriya Janata Dal-hosted (RJD) Iftar party, Tejashwi Yadav said that RJD has never aligned itself with RSS, BJP, or its allies. He added that RJD's opinions are not formed on "ideology of convenience". He further stated that politicians across party lines had been invited to event.

58.title: Open to implementing Uniform Civil Code but won't rush: Himachal CM
58.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Monday said that the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code in the neighbouring state of Uttarakhand has sent a "good message". The Himachal Pradesh government is "open to implementing it but it won't rush," he said. "We will examine the outcome of UCC in other states and then make a decision," Thakur said.

59.title: Illegal colonies in country a menace to urban development: SC
59.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday observed that the mushrooming of illegal colonies in India is a menace to urban development, adding that there's a need for state governments to prevent these from coming up. "We have seen floods in Hyderabad and Kerala, all this is because of irregular colonies," said a bench of Justices L Nageswara Rao and BR Gavai.

60.title: World's 6th richest man Buffett to auction one last private lunch for charity
60.article_body: Warren Buffett, the 91-year-old Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth richest person, will auction off a private lunch for one last time to raise money for charity. Buffett has held the lunch auction since 2000 and raised nearly $34.5 million for charity over the years. In 2019, cryptocurrency pioneer Justin Sun paid record $4,567,888 to dine with Buffett.

61.title: Delhi reports 1,011 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate jumps to 6.4%
61.article_body: Delhi has reported 1,011 fresh cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, marking the fourth day of over 1,000 new cases in the city. One related death was also recorded in Delhi in the last 24 hours while 817 people recovered from the disease in one day. The city's daily positivity rate jumped to 6.42% from 4.48% on Sunday.

62.title: Stupid, childish of him: Rahul Rawail on Deepak Tijori's claims on 'Anjaam'
62.article_body: 'Anjaam' director Rahul Rawail has responded to actor Deepak Tijori's claims about Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 1994 film 'Anjaam' saying it is "stupid and childish of him". Deepak had said that it's the only film he regrets doing because he wasn't happy with the way it was made. "Shah Rukh and I used to wonder, 'What's this director doing?'," Deepak said.

63.title: Angry Ola customer ties e-scooter to donkey, parades it around city in Maha
63.article_body: An angry Ola Electric customer tied his e-scooter to a donkey and paraded it with posters asking people not to trust the company in a city in Maharashtra's Beed district. The customer claims the e-scooter stopped working six days after it was purchased. The man said his scooter wasn't fixed and his calls to customer service led to "vague responses".

64.title: Thanks for putting me to good use: SRK to 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh' author
64.article_body: Writer Shrayana Bhattacharya, who wrote the book 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh', met the actor on Sunday and gave him a copy of her book. The actor gave Shrayana a handwritten note, writing, "Thank you for putting me to some good use. My love and thanks to you and all those wonderful women who like me so much."

65.title: K'taka makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID-19 surge
65.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday issued guidelines making face masks mandatory in public places, workplaces and on public transport amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in parts of the country. People have been asked to maintain social distancing, a minimum of two feet, in public places, an official order said. Spitting in public places will be punishable with a fine.

66.title: More than half of India’s 900 million workforce stop looking for jobs: Report
66.article_body: More than half of the 900 million Indians of legal working age aren't looking for jobs, data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) has indicated. In March 2022, the labour force shrunk by 3.8 million to 428 million, marking its lowest since July 2021, data showed. The overall labour participation rate dropped from 46% to 40% during 2017-2022.

67.title: Ex-Mumbai Mayor arrested over attack on Somaiya, granted bail later
67.article_body: Former Mumbai Mayor and Shiv Sena leader Vishwanath Mahadeshwar and three others were arrested on Monday in connection with an attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya. However, the ex-Mayor was granted bail on medical grounds later, Mumbai Police said. Somaiya had on Saturday claimed that he was injured in an alleged stone-pelting incident by Shiv Sena workers in Mumbai.

68.title: I'm trying very hard to do justice to Smita Patil's legacy: Prateik
68.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his scene with his late mother Smita Patil's portrait in 'Cobalt Blue', has said, "It's a feeling I find difficult to articulate." "It will forever be a precious moment and memory for me," he added. Speaking about making correct career choices, Prateik said, "I'm...trying...hard...I hope people feel that I'm indeed doing justice to her legacy."

69.title: Have to take permission from wife Mira to spend money: Shahid Kapoor
69.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that he has to take permission from his wife Mira Rajput to spend money. "I would spend all out before but now I am a family man...I have to give it thought," he further stated. Shahid, however, added that he did not take permission for his recent boys' trip as it comes under his "rights".

70.title: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar marries Nikhil Bhargav
70.article_body: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar tied the knot with Nikhil Bhargav in Bengaluru on Monday. Nikhil works at an advertising agency and the couple met through mutual friends. Television actor Chandan Kumar shared a picture with the couple. Rashmi and Nikhil got engaged in November 2021. Their wedding was attended by family members and friends observing the COVID-19 norms.

71.title: Amazing to enter top-10 on same date as my idol Nadal: 18-yr-old Alcaraz
71.article_body: After entering top 10 for first time in his career at the age of 18 on Monday, Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he's happy. He added that it's "amazing" to do it on same date like his idol Rafael Nadal did 17 years ago. Alcaraz climbed two spots from 11 to nine in ATP world rankings after winning 2022 Barcelona Open.

72.title: Cong has been tried, tested & dusted; see no future for it: KT Rama Rao
72.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said that Congress has been tried, tested and dusted, adding that he sees no future for the party. "We've no relations with Congress. It's a redundant institution. The people of India gave them opportunities for over 50 years. The country has been let down by Congress and BJP," he said.

73.title: Indian sailors held captive by Houthi rebels released: MEA
73.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said that seven Indian sailors, who were under the detention of Houthis in Yemen since January 2, 2022, have been released. According to MEA, the sailors reached Muscat, Oman, on April 24 and were expected to travel back to India shortly. The Centre thanked all the concerned authorities for the sailors' release.

74.title: HC refuses to quash FIR against Amravati MP and her MLA husband
74.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday refused to quash an FIR filed against Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana, both arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row. The concerned FIR alleged that the couple jostled and argued with the police when they were asked to get in the police vehicle after being arrested.

75.title: No need to display religious sentiments in public: Sharad Pawar
75.article_body: Amid a political row in Maharashtra over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said there is no need to display religious sentiments in public. "If efforts are made to spread hatred against communities or classes, adverse effects would be seen in society. Maharashtra never experienced this," he said.

76.title: Deposed Myanmar leader Suu Kyi awaits verdict in corruption case trial
76.article_body: A Myanmar court on Monday deferred its first verdict in corruption case trial of deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi, for which she could face jail time of up to 15 years. Her verdict was postponed to Tuesday, Reuters reported quoting a source. Suu Kyi, who was arrested during coup, has been accused of misappropriating charity money, among other allegations.

77.title: Poland, Sweden to organise donor conference to raise funds for Ukraine
77.article_body: Poland and Sweden will organise an international donor conference in Warsaw on May 5 to raise funds for Ukraine amid its invasion. "The conference will initiate a series of aid events...in...upcoming months," the event's press release stated. According to UN, an estimated 13 million people in Ukraine are in need of humanitarian aid, including shelter, food and medical supplies.

78.title: Twitter set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer: Report
78.article_body: Twitter is set to agree on its sale to the world's richest man, Elon Musk, for around $43 billion in cash, Reuters reported on Monday. It is the price that Musk had called his "best and final" offer for the social media company. Twitter may announce the $54.20-per-share deal later on Monday, Reuters added.

79.title: Musk responds to his alleged old e-mail on Twitter, Instagram; shares 'Instagram curse'
79.article_body: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter, responded to an e-mail he allegedly wrote in August 2018 about Twitter and Instagram. In the e-mail, Musk allegedly wrote, "Will tweet as I wish and suffer the consequences...I just deleted my Instagram. Weak sauce." On Monday, Musk responded to the e-mail by tweeting, "The Instagram curse: Water everywhere, yet always thirsty."

80.title: 'Ultimate finisher' Dhoni is the identity of IPL: Irfan Pathan
80.article_body: Calling MS Dhoni the "greatest and ultimate finisher" in IPL's history, Irfan Pathan said CSK wicketkeeper-batter is the identity of the league and its true ambassador. "Year after year, someone else has been joining this list but no one has been able to displace Dhoni," he added. Dhoni has scored 120 runs from seven matches in IPL 2022 so far.

81.title: Carlos Alcaraz is a future world number one: Prakash Amritraj
81.article_body: After Carlos Alcaraz won the Barcelona Open, former tennis player Prakash Amritraj took to Twitter and opined that the 18-year-old Spaniard will be men's world number one tennis player in the future. "He is going to be part of whatever big number exists at the time," Amritraj further tweeted. Carlos defeated Pablo Carreno Busta in the Barcelona Open final.

82.title: India finishes with 28 medals at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022
82.article_body: India ended its campaign at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022 in Sao Paulo with 28 medals, which includes eight golds, seven silvers and 13 bronzes, on Sunday. World number three Sukant Kadam won a silver in the SL4 category after losing to fellow Indian Tarun Dhillon in the final. Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Pramod Bhagat secured 2 bronze medals.

83.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS, PBKS make 3 changes to their playing XI
83.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS have made three changes to their playing XI, with Shahrukh Khan, Nathan Ellis and Vaibhav Arora being replaced by Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Sandeep Sharma and Rishi Dhawan. CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

84.title: RBI moving towards managing inflation won't hurt growth: FM
84.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the RBI's plan to begin moving towards management of inflation wouldn't hurt India's economic growth. "The growth is not getting compromised, because [government] policies...have also been in such a way that supply-side supports have continued including infrastructure investments," she stated. She also defended RBI's timing to pivot toward inflation.

85.title: BMW to help create tool to trace carbon footprint of batteries
85.article_body: A group of 11 carmakers and battery producers, including BMW, has received $8.78 million from Germany to develop a "battery passport". The German government said the tool will trace the content and carbon footprint of batteries in Europe. This comes as from 2024, rechargeable EVs, light transport and industrial batteries sold in Europe might have to disclose their carbon footprint.

86.title: I'm typecast as 'urban girl next door', looking to break it: Barkha
86.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh in an interview has stated that she is often typecast as an urban girl next door", adding the magazine covers have called her the digital girl next door. "I'm looking to break out of that image to do something a little more desi. There has to be a way to come around it," the actress added.

87.title: India's GDP expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23: CII President
87.article_body: Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President TV Narendran said India's GDP is expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23, with exports playing a key role. Referring to the Russia-Ukraine war, Narendran said no country can remain unaffected from events taking place outside its borders. "Even though India's...economic engagement with Russia or Ukraine is low, this does not shield us," he added.

88.title: He'll find a way to battle through it: Vettori on Kohli's form in IPL 2022
88.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form in IPL 2022, ex-New Zealand spinner Daniel Vettori said the RCB batter will find a way to battle through it, adding the way is through his "aggressive" nature. Kohli, who has scored 119 runs in eight matches so far with an average of 17, got out for golden ducks in the last two matches.

89.title: Indonesia's palm oil export ban will exclude crude palm oil: Reports
89.article_body: Palm oil companies were told by Indonesian government officials on Monday that the export ban on palm oil wouldn't cover export of crude palm oil, Reuters reported citing sources. President Joko Widodo had announced on Friday that palm oil exports would be banned in Indonesia from April 28. He said the export ban aims to ensure domestic food product availability.

90.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal dances in hospital before her breast cancer surgery
90.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently revealed that she is fighting breast cancer, danced in the hospital before her surgery. Sharing a video of her dance video on Instagram, the actress wrote, "Doc said, Chhavi...You need to chill! So I'm chilling #preppingforsurgery." In an earlier post, the actress wrote, "Early detection is the only key and it's worth every effort."

91.title: SDMC to launch month-long anti-encroachment drive
91.article_body: The BJP-ruled South Delhi Municipal Corporation will launch a month-long anti-encroachment drive at several places, civic authorities said on Monday. "Encroachers will not be spared," said SDMC Mayor Mukesh Suryan, adding that before the anti-encroachment drive is launched, notices will be sent to those who have encroached upon public land, roads and footpaths.

92.title: Pune Police seize cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh
92.article_body: The Pune Police crime branch has recovered a cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh and 14 live rounds from four people including one dealer. The first arrest was made after the officials of unit 6 learned about a possible weapon sale in Wagholi. The accused shared information about the people who bought weapons from him in police custody.

93.title: Free booster COVID vaccine shots for all aged above 18 at Haryana govt centres
93.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday announced that it will provide free booster COVID-19 vaccine doses to the eligible population aged above 18 at government vaccination centres. This will cost the state government ₹300 crore, the Haryana Directorate of Information said. The state has about 1.2 crore beneficiaries in the 18 to 59 years age group, it added.

94.title: Japan sends envoy to Solomon Islands over China security pact worry
94.article_body: Japan sent its Vice Foreign Minister Kentaro Uesugi for a three-day trip to Solomon Islands on Monday amid concerns over latter's security pact with China. Uesugi's trip comes after US sent a delegation to Solomon Islands and warned of action if a permanent Chinese military presence is set up there. Australia and New Zealand have also voiced concerns over pact.

95.title: Ishan Kishan had a miserable time batting against LSG: Sunil Gavaskar
95.article_body: Ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar said MI's Ishan Kishan had a "miserable time" batting against LSG on Monday. "Ishan just walked off [after his dismissal]...he just wanted to get out of his misery," he stated. Ishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe and Jason Holder took the catch.

96.title: Gadkari announces Pune-Aurangabad expressway, to reduce travel time to 1.15 hrs
96.article_body: An access-controlled expressway will be constructed between Aurangabad and Pune at a cost of ₹10,000 crore, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari announced. This will reduce the travel time between the two cities to 1.15 hours. There will be no turns and the vehicles could move at a speed of up to 140 km per hour.

97.title: Cong to constitute 'empowered action group 2024' for Lok Sabha polls
97.article_body: Congress will constitute an 'empowered action group 2024' to address political challenges ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, party leader Randeep Surjewala announced on Monday. The decision was taken after a meeting on poll strategist Prashant Kishor's proposal to revamp the party. Notably, this also comes amid speculations of Kishor joining Congress, although no formal announcement has been made yet.

98.title: Water supply to be hit for 12 hours in Kalyan, Dombivli tomorrow
98.article_body: Kalyan and Dombivli areas in Maharashtra's Thane district will face a 12-hour water cut from 8 am on Tuesday. The water cut has been announced in order to undertake the repairs and restoration work in Barave, Mohili, Netivali and Titwala water treatment plant. Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) officials urged residents to use water sparingly during the next few days.

99.title: Govt blocks 16 YouTube news channels for 'spreading disinformation'
99.article_body: The government on Monday said it has blocked 16 YouTube news channels "for spreading disinformation related to India's national security, foreign relations and public order". Six of the blocked channels are Pakistan-based and 10 are based in India, the government has said. The channels "were spreading false...information to...incite communal disharmony and disturb public order", it said.

100.title: Lawyers 'manhandle' policemen outside Delhi court post assault on colleague
100.article_body: Two policemen were allegedly pushed and manhandled by lawyers outside the Karkardooma Courts Complex on Monday, who were protesting against the alleged assault on a colleague by a sub-inspector on Sunday. "Two police officers on Sunday misbehaved with lawyer Neeraj Jha, who went to the Nand Nagari police station to meet his client," said Shahdara Bar Association president VK Singh.

101.title: CBSE is Central Board of Suppressing Education: Rahul Gandhi
101.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday termed the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) as the 'Central Board of Suppressing Education'. This comes a few days after CBSE removed several chapters from the history and political science syllabus of classes 10 and 12. He also termed the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh as the 'Rashtriya Shiksha Shredder' for modification of the syllabus.

102.title: Israel embassy unveils street-art in Delhi, honours Indo-Jewish actors
102.article_body: The Israeli embassy on Monday unveiled a street-art mural in New Delhi's Connaught Place to mark 30 years of bilateral relations. The mural, inaugurated by Israeli Ambassador Naor Gilon and Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi, highlights contributions of Indian-Jewish actors Nadira, Sulochana and Pramila. The mural was designed by Delhi Street Art Founder Yogesh Saini and team.

103.title: Father throws his 2 children in well in Jaunpur, both found dead
103.article_body: A man had allegedly thrown his two young children in a well in Naipoora village of the Jaunpur district in Uttar Pradesh. The bodies have been brought out of the well and have been sent for post-mortem, police said. Notably, the accused, Irfan's mental condition was not well since he returned from Saudi Arabia five years ago, police said.

104.title: Vijay Varma recreates Kareena's 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' dialogue
104.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma on Monday shared a video on Instagram recreating Actress Kareena Kapoor's viral dialogue from 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. He wrote, "The only Gag I ever wanted to play with Kareena, the only and ultimate Poo." Kareena also joins him making funny faces. They shot the video on the sets of 'The Devotion of Suspect X'.

105.title: Pleased with the way we competed: Lampard after Everton's loss to Liverpool
105.article_body: Despite Everton slipping into the EPL's relegation zone after a 2-0 defeat against Liverpool on Sunday, manager Frank Lampard has said that he is "pleased with the way" Everton competed. "In terms of performance, I am more positive...There are 18 points to fight for...It is important for the players...not to get...into that in a negative way," Lampard said.

106.title: Thane woman loses ₹71.15 lakh to man who promised her a crematorium tender
106.article_body: A 54-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Thane was cheated of ₹71.15 lakh by a man who promised her a tender for maintenance of a crematorium in Navi Mumbai. The woman has a water supply business and she had met the accused in 2017. The 28-year-old accused has been booked but he is yet to be arrested.

107.title: Thieves use bulldozer to dig out ATM machine in Maha, CCTV video goes viral
107.article_body: A now-viral video has shown thieves digging out an ATM machine using an excavator in the Miraj area of Maharashtra's Sangli. The incident took place on Saturday (April 23) at a booth of an Axis bank ATM carrying ₹27 lakh cash. The video shows the stolen bulldozer smashing the booth's glass door, digging the ATM out and dragging it.

108.title: 95% patients visiting Delhi mohalla clinics happy with services: CM
108.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said 95% of the patients visiting 'Aam Aadmi Mohalla' clinics in the national capital are satisfied with the services provided there. "We have opened two mohalla clinics in Delhi's most posh area, Greater Kailash, and a lot of rich patients also come to these centres," Kejriwal told Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann.

109.title: Twitter in final stages of negotiation for its sale to Elon Musk: Report
109.article_body: Twitter is in the final stretch of negotiations with the world's richest person, Elon Musk, about a potential sale of the microblogging site, Bloomberg reported on Monday. "Twitter could reach an agreement as soon as Monday," Bloomberg added, without specifying the date. A few days ago, Musk had said that he had secured $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter.

110.title: Over 1,000 people fined for not wearing face masks in Noida: Police
110.article_body: Over a thousand people were penalised across Noida and Greater Noida in a day after they were allegedly found without face masks in public places amid a rise in COVID-19 cases, police said on Monday. After a rise in the number of positive cases in Gautam Buddh Nagar, the UP government made wearing face masks mandatory in public places.

111.title: Jared Padalecki 'lucky' to survive 'bad car accident': Jensen Ackles
111.article_body: Actor Jensen Ackles has stated that his 'Supernatural' Jared Padalecki couldn't join a fan convention in New Jersey he was attending as the latter was in "a very bad car accident". Jensen further said that Jared is "lucky to be alive" thanks to the airbags. "He wasn't driving. He was in the passenger seat...Really, really bad car accident," Jensen added.

112.title: Twitter executives met Musk to discuss $43 bn takeover bid: Reports
112.article_body: Twitter executives met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday to discuss his $43 billion takeover offer, reports said. The development comes after Musk revealed that he has secured $46.5 billion in funding to take the social media company private. Musk has been meeting with Twitter shareholders recently to seek support for his bid, Reuters reported.

113.title: Not satisfied with Police's status report on security at Delhi CM's home: HC
113.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday said it was not satisfied with the status report filed by the Delhi Police regarding security arrangement outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence, which was vandalised by a group of protesters. "You'd put up barricades...received intimation about the protest. But, what kind of 'bandobast' (arrangement) did you put in place," the court asked the police.

114.title: Those two are the best in history: Rublev on Nadal and Djokovic
114.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) debate, world number eight Andrey Rublev said both Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic "are the best in history". He added, "Now they are fighting for one of them to somehow prevail and be alone on that throne." Nadal is a 21-time Grand Slam champion, while Djokovic has won 20 Slams.

115.title: Power comes and goes, some are anxious after losing Maha polls: Pawar
115.article_body: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar commented on the BJP by saying that some people are "anxious" after losing the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly polls in 2019. "Power comes and goes...Some people are getting anxious...because before the state election, claims were made of coming again to power but it did not happen and hence they are anxious," Pawar said.

116.title: BJP forms 'weak booth committee' team ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls
116.article_body: BJP has constituted 'weak booth committee' team in a bid to make party stronger ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, party leader Dilip Ghosh said on Monday. "There are four members per committee spread across [India]. The purpose of [this] is to expand BJP's presence wherever it's weak," Ghosh added. BJP's Baijayant Jay Panda also chaired meeting in this regard.

117.title: No target is too big for Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game: Hogg
117.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said no target is too big for MS Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game. "Whether it's 15 runs...or 30 runs an over, Dhoni...believes that he can get his team over the line," Hogg stated. On Thursday, Dhoni scored 16 runs in the last four balls of the final over to help CSK beat MI.

118.title: Liverpool back within 1 point of Man City after derby win vs Everton in PL
118.article_body: Liverpool moved back within one point of leaders Manchester City in the Premier League standings after a 2-0 win against Everton in the Merseyside derby on Sunday. Andy Robertson and Divock Origi scored for Liverpool in 62nd and 85th minute respectively. Meanwhile, Christian Pulisic netted a 90th-minute winner to help Chelsea beat 10-man West Ham United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.

119.title: Mandhana engages in verbal fight with Rajasathan players after 'mankad' run-out
119.article_body: During a Senior Women's T20 League match against Rajasthan, Maharashtra opener Smriti Mandhana got involved in a verbal fight with the opposition players after being dismissed to a 'mankad' run-out. Mandhana was seen exchanging words with Rajasthan players while the decision was being referred to the third umpire. Mandhana got out for 28(30).

120.title: Will not tolerate invasion: Taliban on alleged Pakistan airstrikes on Afghanistan
120.article_body: Afghanistan's acting Defence Minister Mullah Mohammad Yaqoob has said Taliban would not tolerate "invasions" from its neighbours after Taliban administration blamed Pakistan for airstrikes that officials said killed dozens in Kunar and Khost provinces. Yaqoob said, "We have tolerated that attack...next time we might not tolerate it." Pakistan said the two countries are "brotherly countries".

121.title: Banks ask NPCI to clarify stance on UPI for crypto trading: Report
121.article_body: Several banks have asked the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to issue a formal directive over restrictions regarding the use of United Payments Interface (UPI) to purchase and sell virtual digital assets, the Economic Times reported. Some banks have blocked UPI for crypto trading following "verbal instructions" from NPCI, the report said, adding a circular from NPCI is unlikely.

122.title: Had 15-min role, no idea how director changed it to 40 mins: Charan on Acharya
122.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said initially he had a 15-minute role in the movie 'Acharya'. "Pooja Hegde and I were just supposed to make cameo appearances. I've no idea how Siva developed it into a 40-minute role," he added. "Here, I'd like to thank director SS Rajamouli for allowing me to shoot for 'Acharya' amidst the filming of RRR," Charan said.

123.title: Dhoni's shoes can't be filled, but Jadeja definitely has it in him: Rayudu
123.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu has said that their captain Ravindra Jadeja has the leadership qualities in him not only to lead CSK but also Team India in the future. "Filling in MS Dhoni's shoes, it's never going to happen. But Jadeja definitely has it in him and under the guidance of Mahi bhai (Dhoni)...Jadeja will become better," he stated.

124.title: Rise in policy rates not anti-national activity: Raghuram Rajan
124.article_body: Politicians and bureaucrats need to understand that rise in policy rates isn't some anti-national activity benefiting foreign investors, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan wrote on LinkedIn. He added, "Inflation's up in India...At some point, the RBI will have to raise rates, like the rest of the world." His remarks came as India's retail inflation reached a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March.

125.title: Mevani re-arrested in new case after getting bail in case over tweets on PM
125.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was re-arrested in a new case just after he was granted bail on Monday by a court in Assam in case over tweets on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Mevani had been taken back to the Kokrajhar Jail after the hearing. His counsel had earlier said that he had been granted bail and formalities were being completed.

126.title: Modern Love Mumbai starring Fatima, Arshad & Pratik Gandhi to release in May
126.article_body: Modern Love Mumbai starring actors Fatima Sana Shaikh, Arshad Warsi and Pratik Gandhi will release on May 13. The Mumbai chapter of the US original anthology series Modern Love, helmed by John Carney, has brought together six filmmakers Vishal Bhardwaj, Hansal Mehta, Shonali Bose, Dhruv Sehgal, Alankrita Shrivastava and Nupur Asthana. It will feature stories about discovering love.

127.title: Karan to return with 'Koffee with...'; new season goes on floors in May: Reports
127.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar and his team are reportedly gearing up to start shooting for the new season of 'Koffee with Karan'. According to reports, the planning and pre-production have already begun and the team is now ready to start shooting from mid-May. The show is expected to go on air in the month of June on Star Network, reports added.

128.title: BJP leader Tarachand Chheda dies aged 71 due to post-COVID-19 complications
128.article_body: Former minister and BJP leader Tarachand Chheda passed away aged 71 at his home in the Bhuj town of Gujarat's Kutch. Chheda had been suffering from post-COVID-19 complications after contracting the infection in January this year. "The viral disease left his lungs damaged which led to pneumonia and he could not recover from that," Chheda's younger son said.

129.title: Future Group shares fall up to 20% after Reliance cancels deal
129.article_body: Shares of Future Group companies plummeted on Monday, with Future Lifestyle Fashions and Future Supply Chain Solutions each trading 20% lower. Meanwhile, Future Retail stock dropped 5% to ₹27.80 per share.This comes after Reliance Industries called off its ₹24,713-crore deal to acquire Future Group's assets after secured creditors of the latter voted against the proposal.

130.title: 'KGF Chapter 2' becomes 6th highest-grossing Indian movie, earns ₹883 cr globally
130.article_body: Kannada film 'KGF Chapter 2' earnings jumped on Sunday, taking its total worldwide earnings to ₹883 crore, according to film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. The Yash-starrer film is now the sixth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, according to the film trade analyst. It overtook Aamir Khan's blockbuster PK's lifetime gross earnings of ₹854 crore, The Hindustan Times reported.

131.title: Heatwave predicted in 12 states & 1 UT in the next 5 days, list released
131.article_body: IMD has predicted heatwave conditions over the next five days in isolated pockets of Gujarat and Odisha. Heatwave is likely in north coastal Andhra Pradesh and sub-Himalayan West Bengal during April 25-27, in west Rajasthan and mid-Maharashtra during April 26-29 and in Bihar, Jharkhand during April 25-28. Punjab, south Haryana-Delhi, south UP, MP to face a heatwave during April 27-29.

132.title: AI helps Pune graduates prepare for interviews, apply for jobs
132.article_body: Over 3,000 students in less than 15 days have used Savitribai Phule Pune University's AI-assisted digital smart interview platform to prepare for upcoming interviews. "The industry has its requirements ready and they have the job openings as well, the AI is helping to identify which candidates can fit in and where," said Dr Nitin Karmalkar, Vice-Chancellor, SPPU.

133.title: RGV praises Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona', calls it 'marvellous'
133.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise actor Kichcha Sudeepa's upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', writing, "Had...good fortune to see some 3D footage of 'Vikrant Rona'...And I must say it's looking next level. Absolutely marvellous." "Can't wait to see full film on July 28," he added. It will release in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam.

134.title: SC agrees to list pleas against removal of Article 370 after summer vacation
134.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to consider listing after summer vacation the pleas challenging the abrogation of Article 370. A bench comprising Chief Justice NV Ramana and Justice Hima Kohli took note of senior advocate Shekhar Naphade's submissions. "Let me see...This is a five-judge matter. I will have to reconstitute the bench," CJI Ramana said.

135.title: Fire breaks out at oil depot in Russia's Bryansk
135.article_body: A large fire broke out at an oil depot in Russia's Bryansk city, located about 154 km from the Ukrainian border, the country's Emergencies Ministry said on Monday. No injuries were reported in the incident and the authorities said that the need to evacuate the city did not arise. A probe has been ordered into the incident.

136.title: Was rejected for TV show, makers said they'll have to put on extra lights: Nawaz
136.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview recalled an incident when a television show's team refused to cast him. "[They said] 'We'll have to put on extra lights, we've to send one episode every day...If we cast you, it'll take 1.5 days, we'll face losses...Better you find something else'," he said. Nawazuddin further said he then decided to find work in movies.

137.title: Philippines begins administering 2nd booster dose against COVID-19
137.article_body: The Philippines on Monday began administering a second COVID-19 vaccine booster shot to individuals with low immunity. According to the Philippines' Health Department, the initial rollout of these shots aims to inoculate about 7,000-13,000 persons deemed most vulnerable. South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore are among other Asian countries that have approved a second booster shot.

138.title: Don’t give more weapons to Ukraine: Russia tells US
138.article_body: Russia has asked the US to stop sending weapons to Ukraine. Russian ambassador to Washington Anatoly Antonov said that an official diplomatic note has been sent to the US in this regard. "We stressed the unacceptability of this situation when the US pours weapons into Ukraine and we demanded an end to this practice," Antonov said.

139.title: K'taka seeks report as B'luru school allegedly asks kids to carry Bible
139.article_body: A Karnataka block education officer visited the Bengaluru school which has been accused by right-wing group Hindu Janajagruti Samiti of imposing Bible on students. "I have come here to get a report from the school authority," he said. As per reports, the school took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles.

140.title: Khevrajpur victims were raped before being killed, TMC alleges cover-up
140.article_body: The TMC on Monday alleged a "massive cover-up" in connection with the murder of five members of a family in Uttar Pradesh's Khevrajpur, with the party alleging that women were raped before being killed. In a series of tweets, TMC national spokesperson Saket Gokhale alleged the police were informed that the women were raped, but an FIR wasn't registered.

141.title: Bihar woman chokes husband to death by biting his throat during fight
141.article_body: A woman allegedly choked her husband to death by biting his throat in a village in Bihar's Rohtas district, police said. According to police, the accused committed the crime after she lost her temper during a quarrel with her husband. "The woman was aggressive in nature and often created tension in the joint family," the deceased's elder brother said.

142.title: Sachin Tendulkar's daughter taking acting classes, may debut soon: Report
142.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara has been taking acting classes due to her brand endorsements and may make her Bollywood debut soon, reported Bollywood Life. The report further stated that she has studied medicine at London University but is interested in making a career in the glamour world. In 2015, there were reports of Sara making her debut opposite Shahid Kapoor.

143.title: Kim trolled for photoshopping her waistline in pics, fan says 'Something is off'
143.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian was trolled for photoshopping her recent poolside pictures, with people claiming she edited her waist. It was her midriff that drew the user's attention. One user said, "You forgot to leave in your belly button." "Something is off," another user commented. "You can see where you photoshopped your waist," the other user wrote.

144.title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal joins Urban Company's board
144.article_body: Zomato Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal has joined the board of online home services marketplace Urban Company as an independent director. The company has added three other members to its board, including McKinsey & Co's former partner Ireena Vittal, Helion Co-founder Ashish Gupta and PwC India's former Chairperson Shyamal Mukherjee. Founded in 2014, Urban Company entered unicorn club last year.

145.title: Building undergoing repairs collapses in Delhi; 5 labourers feared trapped
145.article_body: At least five labourers are feared trapped under the debris of a building that collapsed in Delhi's Satya Niketan on Monday, fire officials said, adding that efforts are being made to rescue them. The building was undergoing repair work at the time of the incident. Six fire tenders have reached the spot to carry out the rescue operation, officials added.

146.title: World's oldest living person, Japan's Kane Tanaka, passes away at 119
146.article_body: Japan's Kane Tanaka, who was declared the world's oldest living person by the Guinness World Records, passed away on April 19, 2022, aged 119. The news was confirmed by Senior Gerontology Consultant Robert Young, who also helped confirm Kane's record as the oldest person living and oldest person living (female) in 2019. Tanaka had recently been hospitalised and discharged repeatedly.

147.title: Airline ordered to pay ₹8,000 to man for broken wheel of bag at Bengaluru airport
147.article_body: A man in Bengaluru has won compensation of ₹8,000 from an airline after a wheel of his checked-in trolley bag broke. The incident happened in 2017. The judges hearing the case reportedly reprimanded the airline for service deficiency and ordered that the customer be paid ₹5,000 as compensation for the luggage and ₹3,000 for his court expenses within 45 days.

148.title: Sara Ali Khan to star in a film on 1942 Quit India Movement: Report
148.article_body: Sara Ali Khan has reportedly signed on to star in a film based on 1942 Quit India Movement. As per Pinkvilla, she'll play the lead role in the project which will be helmed by 'Ek Thi Daayan' director Kannan Iyer. The report stated that it'll be released on a digital platform and will be backed by Karan Johar's Dharmatic Entertainment.

149.title: India's Deepak wins 2nd straight silver at Asian Wrestling Championships
149.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia won a silver medal after losing to Kazakhstan's Azmat Dauletbekov 1-6 in 86kg weight category on the concluding day of Asian Championships 2022 in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, on Sunday. It was Deepak's fourth medal in the tournament, having won a silver (2021) and two bronze (2019, 2020) before. Overall, India finished its campaign with 17 medals.

150.title: Punjab will recreate Delhi's education model: CM Bhagwant Mann
150.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said the state will recreate Delhi's education model where students from all economic backgrounds will have equal right to get quality education. "The revolution in education system is discussed across the country. We will replicate the same model in Punjab...The country will progress this way by learning from each other," Mann added.

151.title: All the people living in Hindustan are Indians, and are Hindu: BJP MP
151.article_body: Mansukh Vasava, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP from Bharuch Lok Sabha constituency, said that all people living in Hindustan are Indians and Hindus. "If all become Muslim or Buddhist or Christian then what will happen to Hindus in Hindustan? Have you ever imagined that? I'm not custodian of Hindu religion...Hindu religion is prevailing in entire Hindustan," he added.

152.title: Former Union Home Secy Madhav Godbole passes away at 85 in Pune
152.article_body: Former Union Home Secretary and IAS officer Madhav Godbole (85) passed away at his residence in Pune due to a cardiac failure on Monday, his family said. Godbole held several positions before retiring in 1993 including the Secretary of the Department of Justice. He held a PhD in economics from Mumbai University and an MA from Williams College, Massachusetts.

153.title: Didn't expect something like this: Verstappen after Imola GP win
153.article_body: Following a win at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola, Red Bull driver Max Verstappen has said, "Coming into...weekend I didn't expect something like this but as a team...we executed everything very well." "That's always...hard to do at such an intense weekend with the sprint qualifying as well," he added. This is Verstappen's second Grand Prix win this season.

154.title: Barça are still in top 4 but we've made our lives complicated: Xavi
154.article_body: Speaking after a 0-1 defeat against Rayo Vallecano in La Liga, Barcelona head coach Xavi Hernández has said that his team is in a "tough situation". "We are still in the top four but we have made our lives complicated," Xavi stated. Barcelona are placed second on the La Liga points table with 63 points from 33 matches.

155.title: B'luru garbage trucks to have speed regulators to avoid accidents
155.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will install speed regulators on 588 of its garbage compactors to restrict their speed to 35 km per hour. This comes after a two-wheeler rider was killed by a speeding city garbage truck recently. "To avoid similar mishaps in the future, we'll be providing basic skill development training to drivers," an official said.

156.title: Lata Didi said 'won't do it even for 10cr dollars': Asha on singing at weddings
156.article_body: Veteran singer Asha Bhosle has revealed that her late sister and legendary singer Lata Mangeshkar once turned down an invite to sing at a wedding for 'millions' in compensation, saying, "We do not sing at weddings." Bhosle revealed, "They said they wanted Asha Bhosle and Lata Mangeshkar...[Didi]...told the rep, 'We will not sing even if you offer 10 crore dollars'."

157.title: 66-year-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal to marry 38-year-old teacher Bul Bul Saha
157.article_body: Former India cricketer Arun Lal will tie the knot with 38-year-old Bul Bul Saha on May 2 in Kolkata. The 66-year-old has reportedly taken consent from his first wife Rina Devi, who is ailing. Arun and Rina have divorced, but they still live together due to her illness. Bul Bul is a school teacher by profession.

158.title: Priest arrested for denying Dalit couple entry into Rajasthan temple
158.article_body: A priest has been arrested for allegedly not allowing a Dalit couple to offer prayers at a temple in Rajasthan's Jalore, police said. In a video footage, the priest is purportedly seen stopping the couple at the temple gate and getting into an argument with them. Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi condemned the incident and said all religions are equal.

159.title: I'm upset with party's leadership in Gujarat: Cong's Hardik Patel
159.article_body: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Monday said he isn't upset with Congress leaders Rahul or Priyanka Gandhi but with the party's state leadership. "Elections are coming up...Work should be done together with honest and strong people. They should be given positions," Patel said. He had earlier said his position in Congress is like a groom forced into 'nasbandi'.

160.title: Navneet Rana alleges 'casteist abuse' in jail, says 'not allowed to drink water'
160.article_body: The MP from Maharashtra's Amravati Navneet Rana has alleged she was denied "basic human rights" and "abused in the most filthy language" over her caste in jail. Rana, writing to Lok Sabha Speaker, said she was denied drinking water only because of her caste. "I was told...'we don't let people from 'neechi zaat' Scheduled Castes use our bathrooms'," she alleged.

161.title: HC grants protection to interfaith MP couple who eloped and got married
161.article_body: Nearly 20 days after an interfaith couple from Madhya Pradesh eloped and got married in a temple in Chhattisgarh, MP High Court's Jabalpur bench restrained police from taking action against the man in a kidnapping case lodged by the woman's family. This comes after the Dindori administration demolished three shops and house belonging to the man's family, citing "illegal construction".

162.title: Didn't want to give her a small role: Director on cutting Kajal's role in Acharya
162.article_body: Director Koratala Siva spoke about cutting Kajal Aggarwal's role in 'Acharya'. He said it was inappropriate to cast the actress in a role with no clear ending. "Initally, Kajal's role was designed as a funny role, but after viewing the rushes, I thought it wasn't right to place a star actress in such a small-length role," he added.

163.title: Don't believe in too many changes in the playing XI: Rohit Sharma
163.article_body: On being asked about the Singaporean batter Tim David not featuring in the playing XI, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma said that he doesn't believe in "too many changes". "We want to make sure whoever gets a chance...gets a run in the XI. So we try not to make too many changes...That's how I look at it," Sharma said.

164.title: KTR inaugurates Ferring pharmaceutical facility in Hyderabad
164.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated the Ferring Pharmaceuticals' laboratories plant at Genome Valley in Hyderabad on Monday. The Swiss pharmaceutical company's facility has been established with an investment of an estimated €30 million (over ₹240 crore) and will reportedly provide employment to over 100 people. The company caters to reproductive medicine and maternal health products.

165.title: Heroin worth ₹280 cr seized from Pak boat off Guj coast; 9 held
165.article_body: A joint team of the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad and Indian Coast Guard apprehended nine Pakistani nationals off Gujarat's Jakhau coast and seized over 50 kg of heroin worth ₹280 crore, police said. The accused used a boat named Al Haj to bring in the drugs at the behest of a Pakistani smuggler, said the Director-General of Gujarat Police Ashish Bhatia.

166.title: US oil falls below $100 mark as China lockdowns stoke demand fears
166.article_body: Oil price fell below the $100 mark again on Monday as prolonged COVID-19 lockdowns in China stoked fears regarding waning demand for oil. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.11 to $97.96/barrel, Brent crude fell $4.63 to $102.02/barrel. Oil prices also likely weakened on the prospect of higher interest rates in the US, which is boosting the US dollar.

167.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 5th richest?
167.article_body: Gautam Adani overtook Berkshire Hathaway's Warren Buffett to become the world's 5th-richest person with $123.7 billion wealth, Forbes said. Elon Musk is the richest worldwide with $269.7 billion in wealth, followed by Jeff Bezos, LVMH's Bernard Arnault & family and Bill Gates. Buffett is 6th-richest, followed by Larry Ellison, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Mukesh Ambani and Google's Sergey Brin.

168.title: Health Ministry organises awareness activities across India on World Malaria Day
168.article_body: The Union Health Ministry organised various awareness activities across India on Monday  on World Malaria Day. Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya also called for prioritisation of malaria elimination through national and sub-national efforts. "Our efforts have resulted in 86.45% decline in malaria cases and 79.16% reduction in malaria related deaths in 2021 as compared to 2015," Mandaviya said.

169.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats Djokovic to win 3rd title of 2022 at Serbia Open
169.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-2, 6-7(4-7), 6-0 at Serbia Open to win his third title of the season on Sunday. With this, the Russian has now equalled Rafael Nadal's mark of most titles in 2022. Meanwhile, women's world number one Iga Swiatek won Stuttgart Open for her fourth straight title of the season.

170.title: Jasprit Bumrah has less threatening performances than Shaheen: Aqib
170.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aqib Javed has said that Shaheen Shah Afridi's graph as a pacer is on the rise, whereas, Jasprit Bumrah's graph is stable. "Bumrah's isn't that aggressive...He has less threatening performances than Shaheen, whether it's in T20Is, ODIs or...Tests," Aqib stated. Shaheen has taken 201 wickets in 94 international games. Bumrah has 303 wickets in 156 international games.

171.title: Minor girl gang-raped in Jharkhand’s Ranchi; 3 arrested
171.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly raping a minor girl in Jharkhand's Ranchi, police said on Monday. "Gang-rape with a minor was reported in Chanho police station area of rural Ranchi last evening," said police. "All accused are known to the victim. They called her to meet, then took her to a secluded place and raped her," added police.

172.title: Anushka shares video from her training for 'Chakda 'Xpress', Jhulan reacts
172.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share a video showing how she's preparing for 'Chakda 'Xpress', an upcoming film based on the life of Indian cricketer Jhulan Goswami. "That's how the last few days have been," she captioned the video where she's seen practising on a field. Jhulan reacted to Anushka's post and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

173.title: Confident about Asian Games to be held in September: OCA official
173.article_body: The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) remains confident about the Asian Games to go ahead in Hangzhou in September, a senior official told Reuters. "The OCA has written to Beijing to get more clarity on the situation...The matter will be taken up for discussion at the OCA executive board meeting in Tashkent on May 6," the official said.

174.title: Villagers attack police team in MP, free illegal liquor case accused from custody
174.article_body: A group of villagers allegedly attacked 12 police personnel with sticks and stones and freed an illegal liquor trade case accused from their custody in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district. Five police personnel sustained injuries in the incident and windowpanes of two police vehicles were also damaged, an officer said. A case has been registered against 20 persons, including women.
