175.title: Akshay Kumar asks fans to suggest title for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
175.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Monday asked fans to suggest a title for his Hindi remake of Suriya's 2020 Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru' on social media. The untitled film, which co-stars Radhika Madan, is inspired by the life of Air Deccan founder Captain GR Gopinath and is directed by Sudha Kongara. Fans suggested titles like 'Ucchai', 'Uchayee' and 'Udaan' among others.

176.title: Bitcoin falls to six-week low, Ether declines nearly 5%
176.article_body: Bitcoin fell as much as 3.2% to $38,236 on Monday, marking the crypto's lowest level since March 15. The world's largest cryptocurrency extended this month's losses as investors shied away from risk assets amid a more hawkish outlook for US Federal Reserve policy tightening. Ether, the second-biggest crypto, also slumped 4.8% to $2,799, a level not seen since March 18.

177.title: Casey Affleck joins cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
177.article_body: Casey Affleck has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's next film 'Oppenheimer'. A few pictures of the actor from the sets of the film have surfaced online. 'Oppenheimer' also stars Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt. The film, which is based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer, is expected to release on July 21, 2023.

178.title: Apple's crypto rules raise potential antitrust issues: Coinbase CEO
178.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said Apple has banned a "bunch of features" on its mobile application which creates room for "potential antitrust issues". "Apple so far has not really played nice with crypto," Armstrong said. He added that he believes crypto-compatible phones could be "quite popular" in the future and that smartphone makers should start preparing crypto-specific hardware features.

179.title: Pune entrepreneur wins US award for giving clean potable water solutions
179.article_body: A Pune-based entrepreneur, Rahul Pathak, has won a gold prize at the Edison Awards ceremony in the United States. He won the award for his innovative solution of making clean potable water available quickly at affordable prices for people facing natural calamities. He said, "We are planning to reach the most vulnerable population who are affected by disasters."

180.title: Claims tribunal members to visit violence-hit Khargone on April 26
180.article_body: Two members of a claims tribunal formed by the Madhya Pradesh government will visit violence-hit Khargone to assess damages on April 26. Several properties were damaged when communal clashes broke out after a Ram Navami procession was disrupted in the city. The state government conducted a demolition drive to raze illegal properties following the violence.

181.title: Adani Power sixth Adani group firm to hit ₹1 lakh cr m-cap
181.article_body: Adani Power became the sixth Adani Group firm to cross ₹1 lakh-crore market valuation after its shares hit an all-time high of ₹272 apiece on Monday. The stock has risen over 100% in a month and about 290% since hitting a 52-week low of ₹69.95 in August 2021. Earlier, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, among others, hit this milestone.

182.title: BTS' Jimin's home seized over unpaid health insurance, released later
182.article_body: South Korean band BTS member Jimin's Seoul apartment was seized by National Health Insurance Service over non-payment of his health insurance premiums. The apartment was reportedly seized in January and released on April 22 after the premiums were paid. BTS' agency Big Hit released a statement apologising for the negligence saying that a portion of Jimin's mail had been omitted.

183.title: Amid temperature rise, Bihar temple installs fans, ACs for deities
183.article_body: A Bihar temple has installed fans and air conditioners to protect deities from heat, amid the rising temperature in several parts of north India. "With the help of fans, coolers and ACs, common people are protecting themselves from the heat...thinking on the same lines...we have installed same for Gods and Goddesses here," President of ISKCON temple, Gaya, said.

184.title: KL Rahul has matured way beyond his age: Kevin Pietersen
184.article_body: Ex-England skipper Kevin Pietersen called LSG captain KL Rahul a dynamic player, who has matured way beyond his age. Pietersen added, "To continue scoring runs for different franchises is a damn hard (thing)...there's so much pressure...when you get bought for such big money." The 30-year-old is currently the second-highest scorer in IPL 2022, with 368 runs in eight games.

185.title: 'KGF' director, producer kiss Yash after film's success, picture surfaces
185.article_body: After success of 'KGF: Chapter 2', the distributor of the film, Hombale Films, shared a picture where film's director Prashanth Neel and producer Vijay Kiragandur can be seen kissing actor Yash on the cheeks. "It's just the beginning," Hombale Films wrote. Fans took to the comments section to share old pictures of the trio in the same pose.

186.title: SBI employee cheats 75-yr-old woman of ₹45 lakh in Hyd, arrested
186.article_body: A State Bank of India (SBI) employee was arrested by Hyderabad Police on Friday for allegedly cheating a 75-year-old woman of ₹45 lakh. The accused had promised to help victim download mobile banking app and then gained access to her account by replacing her registered phone number with his number. Accused availed overdrafts on victim's fixed deposits of ₹45 lakh.

187.title: India a technological powerhouse: EU chief on launching trade, tech body with India
187.article_body: India and the European Union (EU) on Monday launched the India-EU Trade and Technology Council to tackle challenges in trade, trusted technology and security. "We have India as a technological powerhouse," said EU chief Ursula von der Leyen while holding talks with PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Till now, EU only had one such council in place with the US.

188.title: People said 'This is why you are gay': Saisha on being sexually assaulted as a child
188.article_body: Talking about being sexually assaulted as a child, designer Saisha Shinde said, "The few people whom I told about it, they said to me 'This is why you are so much into sex, this is why you are gay'." "I never gathered the courage to talk about it after that," Saisha added on 'Lock Upp'.

189.title: Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passes away
189.article_body: Lyricist and Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chief Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passed away on Sunday. Sushma had worked with All India Radio for over three decades. She was also a lecturer of political science and a classical singer. Her last rites were held at Ram Bagh Shamshan Bhumi in Gurugram.

190.title: MP Navneet Rana being mistreated at Mumbai's Byculla jail: Fadnavis
190.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis alleged MP Navneet Rana was being mistreated at Byculla jail, not given drinking water and wasn't allowed to go to washroom in night. "The whole government machinery is scared of one woman," Fadnavis said. Navneet and her MLA husband were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's home.

191.title: Don't get involved in civil disputes: Owaisi to party workers
191.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has asked his party workers not to get involved in civil disputes, especially after an AIMIM corporator Nazir Ahmed Honyal was arrested in the Hubballi stone-pelting incident in Karnataka. "I have come here to advise you all to not interfere in any kind of land or construction issues...Let the law take its own course," Owaisi said.

192.title: Swiggy programme to let delivery partners get managerial-level jobs
192.article_body: Swiggy has launched an accelerator programme called 'Step Ahead' to help its delivery partners get managerial-level jobs with a fixed salary and become full-time Swiggy employees. Swiggy intends to reserve at least 20% of fleet manager hires for its delivery executives. A Swiggy delivery executive "must hold a college degree, possess communication skills and basic computer knowledge" for the role.

193.title: India's military spending 3rd highest in the world at $76.6 billion: Report
193.article_body: India's military spending in 2021 was the third highest in the world at $76.6 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). The five largest spenders in 2021 were the United States, China, India, the United Kingdom and Russia. US military spending reached $801 billion in 2021, while China spent $293 billion on defence.

194.title: Comedienne Bharti Singh shares first picture of her baby boy
194.article_body: Comedienne Bharti Singh on Sunday shared the first picture of her baby boy on Instagram, writing, "Life line." Bharti and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcomed their son earlier this month. She resumed working 12 days after giving birth and was criticised for leaving her child at home. Bharti had responded saying there are some work commitments that cannot be ignored.

195.title: Cyient to buy Finland's Citec for €94 mn in its largest-ever acquisition
195.article_body: Hyderabad-based engineering and technology solutions provider Cyient announced on Monday it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Finland-based Citec, in its largest acquisition to date. Cyient will acquire the plant and product engineering services company for €94 million in an all-cash deal. It will be the largest outbound acquisition by an Indian engineering services company, Cyient said.

196.title: I will be finished the day I start taking audience for granted: Nawazuddin
196.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said reinventing as a performer is the only way to not become "jaded" in the film industry. "The day I stop the process thinking that the audience will love me anyway as I am a great actor, my downfall will begin," he added. "If I take that love, the audience for granted, I am finished," Nawazuddin said.

197.title: Billie Eilish trips during Coachella performance; jokes 'I just ate s***, ouch!'
197.article_body: Billie Eilish fell over on her face during her Coachella 2022 performance. She tripped on stage right after the stage lights dimmed as the singer was getting ready to perform her song 'Getting Older'. After tripping, the singer gathered herself and joked with the crowd saying, "I just ate s**t! Ouch...I'm good. It was dark!"

198.title: Provide relief to farmers, don't make false promises: Punjab Cong chief to Kejriwal
198.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja on Sunday asked AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal to provide relief to the farmers instead of making "fake" and "false" claims and promises. "Nobody stops you and your party’s government in Punjab from providing relief to farmers which you promised, why are you not doing that?" Raja added.

199.title: Medical college in Haryana village to be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur: CM
199.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that a government medical college being built in Haryana's Panjupur village, Yamunanagar district will be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur. The foundation of the college will be laid within three months. Khattar made the announcement while addressing an event organised in Panipat to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur.

200.title: Tap water to homes in Bundelkhand-Varanasi by 2024 is govt's priority: UP minister
200.article_body: UP Jal Shakti Minister Swatantra Dev Singh said it is the government's priority to ensure the supply of clean drinking tap water to the homes of the poor living in villages from Bundelkhand to Varanasi (Kashi) by 2024. The government is working continuously to provide pure tap water to the people in the last line of the society, Singh added.

201.title: J'khand schools told to suspend morning assembly, sports amid COVID-19 surge
201.article_body: The Jharkhand School Education and Literacy Department has asked schools to suspend morning assembly, cultural programmes and sports activities amid rising COVID-19 cases in some states. The schools have been asked to conduct regular health check-ups in coordination with nearest health centres and district administrations have been directed to ensure random COVID-19 tests of students and teachers.

202.title: Female tiger cub found dead in MP's Bandhavgarh Reserve
202.article_body: A female tiger cub was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve (BTR) on Sunday. According to BTR's field director BS Annigeri, the 7-8-month-old cub's carcass showed serious injury marks on the head, stomach, back and ears, in the Dhamokhar buffer zone. It is suspected that the cub was killed in an attack by a male tiger, official said.

203.title: Hindutva is culture, not chaos: Shiv Sena on Hanuman Chalisa issue
203.article_body: Hindutva is a culture and not chaos, Shiv Sena said in an editorial in its mouthpiece, Saamana, on Monday. The statement comes amid the ongoing Hanuman Chalisa issue in the state. "The ruckus that the Bharatiya Janata Party has started in the name of Hindutva at the moment cannot be supported," Shiv Sena said.

204.title: Adani overtakes Buffett to become world's 5th richest person: Forbes
204.article_body: Adani Group's 59-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has overtaken Berkshire Hathaway's 91-year-old CEO Warren Buffett to become the world's fifth-richest person with a net worth of over $123.7 billion as of Friday's close, Forbes said. Adani's net worth stood at $8.9 billion just two years ago, Forbes added. Shares of Adani's businesses are up by between 19% to 195% this year.

205.title: Inzamam-ul-Haq's only Test hit-wicket dismissal came off Monty Panesar
205.article_body: England's Monty Panesar, who turns 40 today, is the only bowler to get ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq out hit-wicket in Test cricket. Trying to sweep Panesar during a Test in 2006, Inzamam lost balance and hit the stumps while attempting to jump over them. Panesar represented England in 50 Tests, with his maiden wicket being that of Sachin Tendulkar.

206.title: 'Extras' joint top-scored in ODI cricket's lowest-ever total
206.article_body: On April 25, 2004, Zimbabwe were dismissed for the lowest-ever ODI total of 35 in 18 overs against Sri Lanka. As many as four Zimbabwe batters got out for ducks while Dion Ebrahim top-scored with 7, same as the number of extras conceded by Sri Lankan bowlers. Sri Lanka won the match by 9 wickets, with 244 balls remaining.

207.title: Vehicle license number 'AA8' sold for ₹73 crore in Dubai
207.article_body: A unique license plate number has been sold for around ₹73 crore (35 million Dirhams) at a charity auction in Dubai. The number is reportedly the third most expensive license plate number in the world. License plate numbers 'F55' and 'V66' were also sold at the auction for four million Dirhams (approximately ₹8.34 crore) each.

208.title: Empty train damages platform after derailing at station in Chennai, pic surfaces
208.article_body: A train climbed the platform after derailing at the Beach station in Chennai on Sunday. The empty Electric Multiple Unit (EMU) was being moved from the yard to platform when the incident happened. The driver jumped out of the train and is undergoing treatment at a hospital, an official said. No case has been registered against him, the official added.

209.title: Akshay, Radhika Madan begin shooting for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
209.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Radhika Madan have started shooting for the Hindi remake of Suriya-starrer film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay took to his social media handles on Monday to share a video showing him and the actress beginning the filming with a coconut-breaking ritual. The yet-untitled remake will be directed by Sudha Kongara, who also helmed the original film.

210.title: CM Bommai should be held responsible: DK Shivakumar on PSI scam
210.article_body: Amid the controversies surrounding the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka, Congress state President DK Shivakumar has criticised the CM Basavaraj Bommai-led state government. "Why did the CM say in the assembly that no mistakes happened in PSI recruitment? He should also be held responsible for lies. Why did he give the case to CID now?" Shivakumar asked.

211.title: Mumbai man held for circulating woman's pvt pics on Insta, blackmailing her
211.article_body: A 21-year-old man from Mumbai allegedly circulated private photos of a 19-year-old woman on Instagram and further blackmailed her in order for her to share her intimate photos with him. Police, with the help of Instagram, tracked down the accused and arrested him. "Any woman who is being threatened in such a manner must approach local police," an officer said.

212.title: NCP leader seeks permission to chant religious prayers at PM's house
212.article_body: NCP leader Fahmida Khan wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday seeking permission to chant prayers of all religions, including namaz, Hanuman Chalisa, Namokar Mantra and Guru Granth Sahib, outside PM Narendra Modi's residence in Delhi. "If Hindutva, Jainism...[can help] the country...reduce inflation, unemployment [and] starvation, I would like to do it," she said.

213.title: 35-yr-old woman stripped and assaulted publicly on camera in Karnataka; 9 booked
213.article_body: A 35-year-old tribal woman was allegedly stripped and assaulted by a group of people in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The incident took place over a land dispute on April 19 and came to light when a video showing the mob stripping the woman as dozens looked on went viral. Police have booked nine persons in the case.

214.title: Tom Cruise's 'The Mummy' is probably the biggest failure of my life: Maker Alex
214.article_body: Alex Kurtzman, who helmed the action-adventure film 'The Mummy', has said the Tom Cruise-starrer film is "probably the biggest failure" of his life, "both personally and professionally". "There's about a million things I regret about it, but it also gave me...many gifts that are inexpressibly beautiful," he added. The film, which was released in 2017, also featured Russell Crowe.

215.title: TN passes Bill to acquire Guv's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities
215.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday passed a Bill seeking to take over the Governor's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities. CM MK Stalin said the state government's lack of power to appoint vice-chancellors impacts higher education in the state. "Even in...Gujarat, one of the three candidates recommended by state government's search committee is appointed vice-chancellor," he added.

216.title: Need to have a chat with other coaches: Jayawardena on MI's batting
216.article_body: After their eighth straight defeat in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said he needs to have a chat with the other coaches to review their performance. "Batting has been a problem area. We have batted under par," Jayawardena added. "We've not hit our straps...we're [also] not taking early wickets...batsmen are scoring centuries against us," he further said.

217.title: Lata Mangeshkar’s brother Hridaynath admitted to hospital, son says he's 'stable'
217.article_body: Late singer Lata Mangeshkar's brother Hridaynath Mangeshkar has been admitted to a hospital, his son, singer Adinath Mangeshkar confirmed on Sunday. Adinath added that the doctors have said that Hridaynath is getting better and will get discharged from the hospital in 10 days. "By the grace of God, he will be back home...He is stable and doing well," Adinath said.

218.title: It was over the top: Parthiv on Krunal's reaction after taking Pollard's wicket
218.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has criticised LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya for the send-off he gave to MI's Kieron Pollard after dismissing him in their match on Sunday. "It's important to give people space...In the dressing room, you can have as much banter as you want...But, this reaction was over the top," stated Parthiv. Krunal kissed Pollard after taking his wicket.

219.title: Dogs found feeding on corpse of woman missing for 6 days in Punjab
219.article_body: A group of dogs was found feeding on the corpse of a woman who had been missing for the last six days in Punjab's Ludhiana. The police have only found skeletal remains of the deceased woman, Guddi Devi. Her daughter identified her with the help of a necklace. Police said that they are waiting for a postmortem report.

220.title: Global military spending hits record high, passes $2 trillion in 2021: Report
220.article_body: The global military spending hit a record high in 2021, crossing $2 trillion for the first time. It reached $2.113 trillion, 12% higher than in 2012, according to a report by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). "Even amid the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic, world military spending hit record levels," said a researcher at SIPRI.

221.title: Panic buying in Beijing amid fears of Shanghai-like lockdown
221.article_body: The Chinese reportedly resorted to panic buying, stocking up food and supplies, in Beijing amid fears of a Shanghai-like lockdown after the authorities ordered mass testing in the Chaoyang district. The residents of Chaoyang have been asked to get tested for COVID-19 three times this week. This comes after the district reported several COVID-19 cases.

222.title: Not going to be easy: Manjrekar on Karthik's T20 WC chances
222.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said it's not going to be easy for RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik to get into India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "When you say we want DK in team, you want a guy out...We'll have to start looking at Hardik Pandya vs Karthik. It's not going to be easy," he explained.

223.title: 2 robbers snatch man's debit card outside Pune ATM, steal ₹2 lakh
223.article_body: Two unidentified robbers allegedly snatched the debit card of a man who was coming out of an ATM in Pune's Dehu on Sunday and stole ₹2 lakh by making multiple transactions, police said. According to the police, one of the accused asked the man to show his debit card and when he refused, the duo snatched it and ran away.

224.title: Very definition of luck deserting you: Harsha Bhogle on Kishan's 'unusual' dismissal
224.article_body: Referring to MI opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against LSG, Harsha Bhogle said, "If you want to know the very definition of luck deserting you, you just saw the entire novel, the entire screenplay." Kishan got caught out in slips after the ball bounced off wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe. Meanwhile, Nick Knight said, "You would not believe it."

225.title: 5 including 4 Indian tourists killed in car-bus collision in Nepal
225.article_body: Four Indian tourists were among five persons who were killed after their car collided with a bus in Nepal's Dhading district, police said. The four Indian nationals were returning to Kathmandu after visiting Pokhara when the accident took place. The Nepalese driver of the car was also killed in the accident.

226.title: Man kills brother after developing feelings for sister-in-law in UP: Police
226.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a man for killing his brother after he allegedly developed feelings for his sister-in-law. The man, Bhupendra Sahu, lived with his brother, Mohit, and sister-in-law in Lucknow. "Bhupendra...started making advances towards her. Mohit's wife...complained...to her husband...brothers had argument over this and Bhupendra overpowered Mohit and slit his throat," police said.

227.title: 3 critically endangered Sumatran tigers found dead in Indonesia
227.article_body: Three critically endangered Sumatran tigers were found dead in Indonesia's Aceh, authorities said on Monday. The tigers, whose population has decreased to about 400, were found with injuries caused due to snare traps, an official said. Under Indonesian law, people who intentionally kill protected animals face up to five years of imprisonment and 100 million rupiah fine (about ₹5.3 lakh).

228.title: IPL share video of Ishan Kishan's wicket, say 'Most bizarre dismissal in IPL?'
228.article_body: The IPL have shared the video of Mumbai Indians (MI) opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), writing, "Most bizarre dismissal in IPL? Ishan’s unusual wicket." Kishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off the shoe of LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock and was caught by Jason Holder in the slips.

229.title: Jamia shooter Rambhakt Gopal shares video of gun pointed at kids in Haryana
229.article_body: Rambhakt Gopal, the shooter who fired at an anti-CAA protest near Jamia Millia University in 2020, has shared a video showing a gun pointed out of an SUV at children and women in Haryana. Another video shows a group of men brandishing pistols and dragging a man into an SUV, with the caption "Taking away the cow smuggler" on Instagram.

230.title: Hunt on for 2 suspects in Nigeria oil blast; death toll rises to 110
230.article_body: A local oil official said on Sunday that the search for two suspects involved in the blast at an oil refining depot in Nigeria's Rivers has been intensified. This comes as a disaster management agency official told AFP that the death toll from the blast has risen to 110. The country's President had called it a "catastrophe and national disaster".

231.title: B'luru woman dies as husband physically assaults, locks her in bedroom
231.article_body: A 48-year-old woman died after her 55-year-old husband physically assaulted her in Bengaluru. Reports said that the husband also locked her in the bedroom for three hours after rendering her unconscious. Their son, who filed a complaint with the police, said his father even used a wooden stick to hit his mother.

232.title: Hated my Mumbai school, was bullied & teachers were not nice to me: Shahid
232.article_body: Shahid Kapoor in an interview spoke about his school life and revealed that he was bullied in his Mumbai school. "I hated my school in Mumbai...I was treated very badly and my teachers were also not very nice to me," he added. "I loved my...[Delhi] school, I was there from Jr KG and I'd a lot of friends," Shahid said.

233.title: Shiv Sena workers still giving threats: Somaiya over 'attack'
233.article_body: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, a BJP Mumbai unit delegation will meet the Union Home Secretary in New Delhi on Monday, the state BJP said. "We'll give a detailed report and demand a special team for inquiry," Somaiya said. "Fake FIR was registered against me. Shiv Sena workers are still giving threats," Somaiya stated.

234.title: 3 bike-borne persons loot ₹80,000 from money changer in Dhuri
234.article_body: Three bike-borne persons allegedly took away ₹80,000 and a mobile phone from a money changer at gunpoint in Punjab's Dhuri on Sunday afternoon. The victim was working at his shop when two persons entered inside and pointed a pistol at him while the third person remained seated on a motorcycle outside the shop, police said.

235.title: 168 killed, 98 hurt in tribal clashes in Sudan's Darfur: Aid group
235.article_body: At least 168 people were killed and 98 others were injured in tribal clashes between Arabs and non-Arabs in Sudan's Darfur region, the General Coordination for Refugees and Displaced in Darfur spokesperson Adam Regal said. He added that the clashes first began on Thursday with the killing of two people. Authorities have deployed troops in the area following the clashes.

236.title: Youth strangles pregnant girlfriend for pressuring him for marriage in Ghaziabad
236.article_body: A 19-year-old youth has been arrested for allegedly strangling his pregnant girlfriend to death with a dupatta in Ghaziabad. Police said that the accused, who was in a relationship with the girl for the past few months, was fed up with her constant appeals to get married. Police had to form several teams to arrest the man, who was absconding.

237.title: Police caught me by shoulder, almost pushed me into a warehouse: Pratik on VIP movement
237.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi described on Twitter how he felt "humiliated" by police's actions when he started walking on road to reach shoot location amid jam due to "VIP movement". Pratik revealed police caught him by shoulder and "almost" pushed him into a warehouse. After a Twitter user mentioned that PM Narendra Modi was in Mumbai, Pratik replied, "Oops...I didn't know."

238.title: Man stabbed to death by his 3 uncles on UP street as passersby watch, act caught on CCTV
238.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was stabbed to death by his three uncles in broad daylight on a street in UP's Meerut on Sunday afternoon. As per police, the uncles had an argument with the deceased, Sajjid, on Saturday and Sunday morning. Police have collected the CCTV footage of the murder and are investigating the matter.

239.title: J&K will soon set example of development for country: LG Manoj Sinha
239.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday said it was a big day for the UT as PM Narendra Modi laid the foundation stones and inaugurated development works worth over ₹20,000 crore. J&K will soon set an example of development for the country, Sinha added. "Now, all laws have been implemented which are helping women and people of J&K," Sinha stated.

240.title: Photo of UP Crime Branch officer smoking hookah with top criminal goes viral
240.article_body: A photo of UP Crime Branch officer Mohammad Asif smoking hookah with a top criminal named Ankit Lala has surfaced on social media. After the photo of Asif sitting with Kanpur's Ankit Lala went viral, the officer was suspended and an enquiry was ordered, reported India Today. Samajwadi Party shared the news on Twitter and demanded action against the officer.

241.title: UP Police's sniffer dog passes away, given farewell with state honours
241.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police's sniffer dog, Vicon, passed away on Sunday due to prolonged illness. Vicon, who was born in 2011, was appointed as sniffer dog for the explosive section in the dog squad of Uttar Pradesh Police in 2012. Vicon was given a final farewell by salute with state honours by senior police officials.

242.title: I don't want to get ahead of myself: KL Rahul on 4th IPL hundred
242.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed his fourth IPL hundred on Sunday, has said he doesn't want to get ahead of himself and is only playing according to the situation in the ongoing IPL season. "Enjoying batting, enjoying the responsibility. Fingers crossed I can keep doing the right things," he added. Rahul scored 103* off 62 balls against MI.

243.title: Attempts being made to divide Tamil Nadu on basis of caste & religion: Stalin
243.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday said attempts are being made to divide the state on the basis of caste and religion. "Some people want to stop the development of the state by dividing us. The people of Tamil Nadu should realise this and act," Stalin added. "Only a peaceful country can achieve all kinds of development," Stalin stated.

244.title: 2 labourers injured in explosion at venue of event in J&K's Rajouri
244.article_body: Two persons were injured in an explosion that took place in Shahpur village of Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday evening. Police said the two injured persons, both local labourers, have been shifted to a nearby hospital. The explosion took place when organisers at an event were packing things at the end of the occasion.

245.title: Maximum temperature in parts of Delhi may touch 45-46°C by April 28: IMD
245.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that the maximum temperature in some parts of Delhi could reach around 45-46°C on April 27 and 28. According to the IMD, there may be some relief from April 28 onwards due to the impact of a western disturbance expected across northwest India. Safdarjung recorded a maximum temperature of 39.5°C on Sunday.

246.title: US officials meet Ukraine Prez, announce military aid
246.article_body: A US delegation, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. The US announced military aid worth $322 million and approved a $165 million sale of ammunition to Ukraine. The US said it will gradually restart embassy operations in Ukraine and the diplomats would return to the war-torn country.

247.title: Mahesh Babu's next with Rajamouli likely to go on floors in Dec: Report
247.article_body: Mahesh Babu's next film with filmmaker SS Rajamouli, tentatively titled 'SSMB29', is expected to go on floors in December this year, according to a report. The actor, who recently completed shooting for his upcoming action-drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata', has reportedly flown to Dubai where he'll discuss the script with Rajamouli. 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' is slated to release on May 12.

248.title: 102 kg heroin worth ₹700 cr from Afghanistan seized at Attari
248.article_body: Indian Customs seized 102 kg of heroin hidden in a consignment of liquorice (mulethi) that was imported from Afghanistan at the Attari check post, officials said. The contraband was concealed in several cylindrical logs resembling liquorice and is worth ₹700 crore in international market, officials added. "We're taking action under NDPS Act," Customs Commissioner of Amritsar, Rahul Nangare, said.

249.title: Drinking water gets 'mixed with sewage' in Punjab; 15 fall sick
249.article_body: As many as 15 people, including seven children, have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in the Gazipur area in Punjab's Zirakpur. Residents alleged that the water supply was contaminated by sewer lines. A telecom company had dug up the area to lay wires, which has caused the mixing of water with sewage, a water supply department official claimed.

250.title: I try to direct films that aren't easy to make: Ajay Devgn
250.article_body: Ajay Devgn has said he tries to direct films that are not easy to make. "I like films that challenge me...If there's...story which inspires me so much that I feel like telling it myself, only then I direct it, otherwise, there's no point," he added. Ajay's 'Runway 34' marks his third directorial venture after 'U Me Aur Hum' and 'Shivaay'.

251.title: B'luru's 1st ANPR camera singles out 25 vehicles, recovers ₹19,900
251.article_body: First Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) camera that was deployed in Bengaluru last week has singled out 25 vehicles with pending cases and has recovered ₹19,900 as fine. The camera takes pictures of offenders and sends details of the offenders to the police personnel stationed nearby. The police then stops the vehicle and collects the fine.

252.title: US’ Nebraska wildfires kill ex-fire chief, injure 15 firefighters
252.article_body: A retired fire chief was killed and at least 15 firefighters were injured in wildfires that swept over parts of the US' Nebraska. According to an official, 66-year-old John P Trumble was overcome by smoke and fire after his vehicle went off-road owing to poor visibility. As many as 14 counties in the state have reported blazes since Friday.

253.title: Tarundeep Rai-Ridhi Phor win their 1st mixed team gold in Archery World Cup
253.article_body: Archers Tarundeep Rai and Ridhi Phor won their maiden recurve mixed team gold as they defeated Great Britain in the final of the Archery World Cup Stage 1. It's India's second gold in the tournament after the men's compound team won on Saturday. Pairing for the first time, 38-year-old Rai and 17-year-old Ridhi won 5-4 (35-37, 36-33, 39-40, 38-37, 18-17).

254.title: Malicious: B'luru DCP on religious procession route change request
254.article_body: Bengaluru city's DCP (South Division) Harish Pandey on Monday replied to a tweet by an organisation seeking to change the route of a temple's religious procession as it passed through areas "mostly inhabited by Muslims", saying, "This is a malicious attempt to create panic." He added that the procession is 35 years old and has "always been welcomed" by residents.

255.title: A boy used to inappropriately touch me after making me strip when I was 6: Kangana
255.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed that she was sexually assaulted when she was aged around six. "A young boy from our town used to inappropriately touch me...He was three to four years elder than me. Perhaps he was exploring his sexuality. He'd call us, get us all to strip and check us," Kangana said.

256.title: Ranveer, Sara, Kriti & Madhuri attend Karan Johar's party, pics surface
256.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recently hosted a dinner party for Global TV Head of Netflix, Bela Bajaria who arrived in Mumbai recently. The paparazzi spotted Madhuri Dixit, Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Sara Ali Khan, Kriti Sanon and other celebrities arriving at Karan's residence. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Karan recently announced a schedule wrap for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

257.title: 2 shot dead in car speeding towards police in Paris after Macron wins election: Report
257.article_body: Paris police have shot two people dead and severely wounded a third person, a woman, after a car came speeding towards them on the oldest bridge in the French capital, Pont Neuf, reports said. The incident took place shortly after midnight, hours after French President Emmanuel Macron won a second term and protests broke out in the capital.

258.title: Freedom of expression doesn't give anyone right to abuse India: Vijayvargiya
258.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya has said that freedom of expression in democracy does not give anyone the right to abuse India and go unpunished. "No other country addresses its nation as 'mother'...Are you okay if someone abuses your mother? Should such people who abuse our mother not be dealt with by law?" Vijayvargiya added.

259.title: Stronger kids bullied me in school, wanted to be a boxer to fight back: Vivek
259.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that "bigger and stronger" kids bullied him in boarding school and he wanted to be boxer to be able to fight them back. "I went to my coach...and he said, 'I will train you'..I ended up boxing not just for myself but for my school...I went to state-level and even competed at the nationals," Vivek added.

260.title: Hero Vired & INSEAD collaborate to launch new management program
260.article_body: Ed-tech company Hero Vired has partnered with world's leading management institute INSEAD to offer certificate program in Strategic Management and Business Essentials in India. The program will include up to 90% live learning, with 50% teaching sessions by INSEAD faculty. The program will cater to mid-senior professionals, entrepreneurs & senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills.

261.title: Scindia, Singh inaugurate 'Yog Prabha' event at Safdarjung Airport
261.article_body: Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia and General VK Singh on Monday inaugurated the mega Yoga event 'Yog Prabha' at Delhi's Safdarjung Airport. Over 500 Civil Aviation Ministry and its affiliated organisations' officials participated in the event. "Common Yoga Protocol, Lecture on Yoga by Expert [and] Yoga Demonstration will be...be undertaken at the event," a statement had said earlier.

262.title: Verstappen wins Emilia Romagna GP to close title gap to 27 points
262.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix to move to the second place in the season's driver standings. He's now 27 points behind the Ferrari's Charles Leclerc, who finished sixth in the race. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished second while McLaren driver Lando Norris finished third. Mercedes' seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 13th.

263.title: EOW inspector, constable arrested for taking bribe from Odisha journalist
263.article_body: The CBI arrested a constable of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW), Delhi, in Bhubaneswar on the charges of taking a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a journalist based in Odisha, promising to remove his name as a witness in a case of forgery. Inspector of EOW in Delhi police was also arrested by CBI in Delhi for masterminding the crime.

264.title: BJP seeks action against Atishi over Kerala officials visit claim
264.article_body: The Delhi BJP unit has sought action against AAP MLA Atishi after she said that officials from Kerala had visited the national capital to study the "Delhi model" of education. Earlier, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty had said that the state government hadn't sent anyone. "It's surprising how Atishi can make such false claims," Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Kapoor said.

265.title: I've noticed growth in Tiger; he has become calmer now: Tara Sutaria
265.article_body: Speaking about her 'Heropanti 2' co-star Tiger Shroff, actress Tara Sutaria said, "I've...noticed his growth as a co-actor and as a friend. I feel he's calmer and cool; with age, all of us tend to calm down." "His musical talent has grown. During 'Student Of The Year 2', I...noticed him humming. In 'Heropanti 2', he's singing as well," she added.

266.title: Most COVID-19 cases in Ghaziabad seen among people aged 21-40
266.article_body: Ghaziabad has registered 371 COVID-19 cases since April 12, most of which have been reported among people aged between 21 and 40 years. As many as 145 (39%) affected patients belonged to the 21-40 years age group. At the same time, the infection rate among those over 60 years was 7.8%, making them the least affected group.

267.title: 2 brothers electrocuted to death while working in the field in Pilibhit
267.article_body: Two brothers died due to an electric shock while working in their fields in UP's Pilibhit district. The deceased, identified as Rajendra Prasad (54) and Rameshwar Dayal (46), had gone to irrigate their fields when an iron bar, held by Rajendra, touched the wire of a nearby tubewell, police said. Notably, Rameshwar died while trying to save Rajendra.

268.title: It looked like he had no intent: Vettori on Pollard's 19(20) vs LSG
268.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said it looked like MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard "had no intent" to score during their chase of LSG's 169-run target. "LSG did bowl well...and executed their strategies well," added Vettori. Pollard came in to bat when MI were 67/4 in the 12th over and scored 19 off 20 as LSG restricted MI to 132/8.

269.title: Man stabbed to death by uncles over consumption of liquor in Meerut
269.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by his two uncles after a spat between the three over the consumption of liquor in Meerut's Lisari Gate area. The incident took place on Sunday when the deceased, Saajid, was returning home after offering namaz, police said. Notably, the accused had objected to the consumption of liquor by Saajid.

270.title: 18-year-old India-born student drowns in US while trying to retrieve football from pond
270.article_body: Clinten Ajit, an 18-year-old Kerala-born high school student, drowned while trying to retrieve a football from a pond in New Jersey. His body was recovered nearly three hours after he had drowned. Police are still investigating the events leading up to the 18-year-old's drowning. His family had immigrated to the US in September 2012 when he was eight years old.

271.title: 4 children injured as crude bombs explode near mosque in West Bengal
271.article_body: Four children were left injured after crude bombs exploded near a local mosque in West Bengal's Malda, police said. The incident reportedly took place when the children started playing with the crude bombs after mistaking them for balls. The condition of two of the children is critical and they are undergoing treatment at the Malda Medical College and Hospital.

272.title: Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever attend wedding reception of Rakesh Bedi’s daughter
272.article_body: Veteran actor Rakesh Bedi hosted a wedding reception for his daughter Ridhima in Mumbai, which was attended by Rakesh's friends from the industry. 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever, Ramesh Sippy, Avtar Gill, Guddi Maruti and Mukesh Rishi were among the prominent celebrities who attended the wedding reception. Ridhima got married on March 20 in Delhi.

273.title: Delhi Metro ridership yet to reach pre-pandemic levels: DMRC
273.article_body: The passenger traffic in Delhi Metro has increased both on weekdays and weekends after various COVID-19 restrictions were lifted, but the footfall is still lower than the pre-COVID-19 pandemic levels, said a Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) official. According to DMRC data, the Metro ridership has reached only up to 66% of the pre-pandemic levels.

274.title: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passes away at 89
274.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passed away at his residence in Kerala's Palakkad on Sunday, aged 89. During his career, Sankaranarayanan served as Governor of Maharashtra, Nagaland and Jharkhand. He held additional charges of Goa, Arunachal Pradesh and Assam as Governor. He was four-time legislator and held agriculture, finance, excise, agriculture portfolios in governments in Kerala.

275.title: India reports 2,541 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 16,522
275.article_body: India has reported 2,541 COVID-19 cases, 1,862 recoveries and 30 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,593 COVID-19 cases and 44 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,522, while the death toll rose to 5,22,223.

276.title: KL Rahul reprimanded for 3rd time in IPL 2022, fined ₹24-lakh for slow over-rate
276.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul has been reprimanded for the third time in IPL 2022. He has been fined ₹24 lakh after his team maintained a slow over-rate against MI on Sunday. Earlier, Rahul was fined 20% of match fee for breaching Code of Conduct against RCB. He was fined ₹12 lakh over LSG's slow over-rate against MI on April 16.

277.title: PM Modi congratulates Macron on being re-elected as French Prez
277.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to congratulate Emmanuel Macron on being re-elected as the President of France, saying, "I look forward to...working together to deepen the India-France Strategic Partnership." Macron won the elections by defeating far-right leader Le Pen with around 58% votes. "I am so proud to serve you again," Macron said on winning the re-election.

278.title: Accept money KCR gives, his bank balance will reduce: T'gana BJP chief
278.article_body: While accusing Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao of misappropriating government funds, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay said that the people of state should accept the money that he distributes. "His bank balance will reduce...or else he will become richer and...you will become poor...Whatever the money he is distributing in election it is your money given by...PM Modi," he added.

279.title: Protests in Paris after Macron wins French President election, police use teargas
279.article_body: Riot police charged and sprayed teargas on demonstrators in central Paris protesting after President Emmanuel Macron was re-elected on Sunday. Macron defeated far-right leader Marine Le Pen. Notably, Macron is the first French President to win a second term in two decades, but Le Pen's result also marks the closest the far-right has ever come to taking power in France.

280.title: Loopholes in anti-defection law, needs amendment: Vice President
280.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for an amendment in the anti-defection law, stating that those lawmakers switching to other parties shouldn't be offered other posts before they are re-elected. "The anti-defection law has certain loopholes. It allows wholesale defection," Naidu added. "Most of the cases of defection are not effectively dealt with and are dealt with affection," Naidu stated.

281.title: Railways to remove encroachments near Pune's Talegaon station
281.article_body: The Pune railway division has given notices to 64 illegal encroachments near the Talegaon station, asking to vacate by April 26, failing which it will take action. The authorities said they will carry out an anti-encroachment drive if the defaulters didn't vacate even after repeated instructions. The people are not cooperating with the Railways, said an official.

282.title: I'm so bad at dancing that even rehearsals don't help: Ajay Devgn
282.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he's so bad at dancing that he never does rehearsals because they don't help. He added that he regularly asks choreographers to change steps or tell them to do it because he can't do those steps. Ajay further said that the worst thing about his film 'Golmaal' was that he had to dance in the movie.

283.title: Twitter begins deal negotiations with Tesla CEO Elon Musk: Report
283.article_body: Twitter on Sunday began deal negotiations after Tesla CEO Elon Musk pursued many of the social media company's shareholders with financing details on his $43 billion acquisition offer, according to a Reuters report. Musk has said Twitter needs to be taken private to grow and become a genuine platform for free speech.

284.title: Called Salman, said 'I've announced it, it's Eid, are you ok': Ajay on Runway 34
284.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that he did not realise that Eid will be falling in the same week as the release of his film 'Runway 34' during the announcement of release date. "First thing I did is...I called up Salman and said 'I've announced this date...it's Eid...are you ok?'. He said 'don't worry, I won't come that week'," Ajay added.

285.title: The season hasn't gone the way we wanted it to: Rohit after 8th defeat
285.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said that the ongoing IPL season hasn't gone the way they wanted it to after they lost their eighth match in the tournament. "[LSG's 169-run target] should've been chased down, but we didn't bat well enough...it [was] important to string partnerships. But [we played] some irresponsible shots in the middle, including [me]," stated Rohit.

286.title: Right-wing groups object to B'luru school making students carry Bible
286.article_body: After a school in Bengaluru reportedly took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles, right-wing groups objected to it, calling it a violation of the Karnataka Education Act. A Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS) spokesperson claimed that it was forcing non-Christians to learn Bible's teachings. The school, however, said that it provides Bible-based education, according to reports.

287.title: Pregnant woman arrested with cocaine worth ₹51 lakh in Mumbai
287.article_body: A 30-year-old pregnant woman from Mumbai's Borivali has been arrested for possession of cocaine worth ₹51 lakh. Police said the woman, who is the wife of an ambulance driver, was using the ambulance to deliver drugs. A police team interrogated her after they spotted her standing near St Francis School, Borivali suspiciously, while holding a small transparent bag.

288.title: Labourer kills man in fight over alcohol money in Pune; arrested
288.article_body: A labourer was arrested for allegedly hitting a man on the head with a rod, leading to the latter's death, after a fight broke out between them over money for alcohol in Pune. The deceased roamed around with a head injury for two days before dying, a police officer said. Head injury had led to internal bleeding, police officer added.

289.title: Pune to have cloudy sky till April-end, rain likely on 2 days: IMD
289.article_body: Pune will continue to have cloudy weather till the end of April, IMD has predicted. "Till April 30, the forecast states that the sky shall remain cloudy," said Anupam Kashyapi, head of the weather forecasting department at IMD, Pune. The city is also likely to witness light rainfall on April 27 and 28, Kashyapi added.

290.title: CSK's Devon Conway marries longtime girlfriend, pic surfaces
290.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) cricketer Devon Conway married his longtime girlfriend Kim in South Africa. Sharing a picture of the couple from their wedding on social media, CSK wrote, "We pronounce you Lion and Lady! Happy #WeddingWhistles to Kim & Conway!" Conway and Kim had got engaged in 2020.

291.title: Indian Idol 12 fame Sayli Kamble marries boyfriend Dhawal, pics surface
291.article_body: Indian Idol 12's second runner-up Sayli Kamble married her boyfriend Dhawal in a traditional Maharashtrian style wedding in Kalyan. The couple had got engaged in December last year. Sayli's co-contestants from Indian Idol 12, Nachiket Lele and Nihal Tauro, attended the wedding. Sayli is currently seen as a captain on Superstar Singer Season 2.

292.title: Krunal jumps on Pollard, kisses him after taking his wicket; video goes viral
292.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya jumping on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard and kissing him after dismissing him in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. Krunal dismissed Pollard on the first delivery of MI's last over. Pollard got out for 19(20). Earlier in the match, Pollard had dismissed Krunal.

293.title: 752 incidents of snatching reported in Delhi in last one month: Police data
293.article_body: Around 752 incidents of snatching were reported in Delhi in the last one month, with an average of 24 such cases per day, police data shows. A total of 1,746 persons have been arrested in the last four months, including 1,237 first-time offenders. Till April 20, 3,063 such incidents were reported, compared to 2,899 in the same period last year.

294.title: French President Emmanuel Macron wins 2nd term, defeats far-right leader Le Pen
294.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron has won the re-election, defeating far-right rival Marine Le Pen. With 97% of votes counted, Macron was on course for 57.4% of the vote, interior ministry figures showed. "Many in this country voted for me not because they support my ideas but to keep out those of the far-right. I want to thank them," he said.

295.title: Man says 2 unidentified men lying on Hyd road, asks police to save them
295.article_body: A Twitter user shared pictures on the microblogging site, claiming that there are two unidentified men lying on a Hyderabad road. "In Dilsukhnagar...Two unidentified men lying on the road near pillar number A1529...Please save them or move them to a safer place," he wrote. Police responded to his tweet by saying that the staff had enquired about the person.

296.title: MI's winless run in IPL 2022 continues as LSG hand them their 8th straight defeat
296.article_body: LSG defeated MI by 36 runs in their IPL 2022 clash at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on Sunday. MI have now lost each of their first eight matches in the tournament. LSG put up a total of 168/6, with captain KL Rahul scoring his fourth IPL hundred. MI were restricted to 132/8. LSG's Krunal Pandya recorded figures of 4-0-19-3.

297.title: Most wanted BKI terrorist Patialavi arrested by Punjab Police
297.article_body: The Punjab Police's Anti-Gangster Task Force on Sunday arrested the most wanted Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terrorist Charanjit Singh alias Patialavi. The accused, who was absconding since 2010, was arrested near Gurudwara Sahib in Dera Bassi following information of him visiting the area. According to officials, Patialavi was wanted in Ludhiana's Shingar cinema bomb blast case among others.

298.title: Guj hospital security guard assaulted, stabbed over parking issue
298.article_body: A 21-year-old hospital security guard in Gujarat's Ahmedabad was allegedly assaulted and stabbed when he tried to intervene between two men fighting over parking on Saturday. The victim, Sandeep Parihar, was admitted to ICU after the incident. Parihar said that one of the men slapped him before another took out a sharp weapon and stabbed him in the stomach.

299.title: Rahul Gandhi, Congress biggest strength of PM Modi: KT Rama Rao
299.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday alleged that Congress is the main reason BJP is getting stronger day by day. He added, "Rahul Gandhi and Congress party is the biggest strength of (PM) Narendra Modi." KTR has further challenged PM Modi and the BJP to take responsibility for mass killings and conflicts or communal incidents happening across the country.

300.title: Thousands of students protest outside Sri Lankan PM's home
300.article_body: Thousands of university students protested outside the home of Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Sunday, calling for him to resign over his handling of the economic crisis. "You can block the road, but can't stop our struggle until the...government goes home," a student protester said. The police claimed that Rajapaksa wasn't at home at the time of the protest.

301.title: SP MLA Ravidas Mehrotra not allowed to meet Azam Khan in UP jail
301.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Ravidas Mehrotra has claimed that officials in UP's Sitapur jail didn't allow him to meet party leader Azam Khan who is lodged there. He added that they didn't even agree to hand over the Iftar food which he had taken for him. Notably, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief and Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav met Khan on Friday.

302.title: India, EU aligned in fight against climate change: EU chief
302.article_body: At the headquarters of International Solar Alliance in Gurugram, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said, "India and...EU are aligned in the fight against climate change." "We've both embarked on our way to net zero. And solar energy will play a key role in getting there," she added. "We'll step up our cooperation on solar energy," she further said.

303.title: Ex-Cong MLA Manilal Vaghela joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
303.article_body: Former Congress MLA Manilal Vaghela joined the BJP on Sunday in the Vadgam town of Banaskantha district ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections due this year. Vaghela had resigned from Congress last year, citing displeasure over the party sidelining him. Notably, Vaghela had won from Vadgam in 2012 Assembly polls but was denied a ticket from the constituency in 2017 elections.

304.title: SII urges Centre to use 10 crore Covishield vaccines given by GAVI
304.article_body: The Serum Institute of India (SII) urged the Centre to immediately use the 10 crore Covishield doses provided free of cost by vaccine alliance GAVI amid rising coronavirus cases, PTI reported. SII said if the doses aren't taken by the government timely, it'll lead to wastage of the vaccines. India reported 2,593 new cases in 24 hours to Sunday morning.

305.title: Odisha Special Task Force seizes 3 elephant tusks, 1 arrested
305.article_body: The Odisha Special Task Force (STF) along with Birmaharajpur forest officials on Sunday seized three elephant tusks weighing 10 kg each after conducting a raid near a village in the Subarnapur district. One person has been arrested and an enquiry is underway. The search was a part of an ongoing special drive against the wildlife criminals and poachers.

306.title: Muslims host Hindu girl's wedding at own home as she couldn't book hall in UP
306.article_body: A Muslim family in UP's Azamgarh offered their home for the marriage function of a Hindu girl in their neighbourhood. Pooja, who lost her father to COVID-19, reportedly couldn't afford to book a marriage hall and her family's house didn't have enough space to hold the function. "[Parvez's] family treated (wedding) guests as if Pooja is their...daughter," said her uncle.

307.title: If you've worked on smart watches & phones, please join Neuralink: Musk
307.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "If you've engineered or manufactured smart watches or phones, please join Neuralink. Your skills are directly applicable." Co-founded by Musk in 2016, Neuralink is a neurotechnology company that is developing implantable brain-machine interfaces to help people with paralysis. In a recent interview, Musk suggested Neuralink could help treat morbid obesity.

308.title: Punjab govt orders probe against 720 schools for raising fees
308.article_body: The Punjab government on Sunday ordered an inquiry against 720 private schools for allegedly raising their fee despite the government's order prohibiting a fee hike. The government ordered the probe based on complaints from parents who claimed the schools disregarded the government's directions. "Strict action will be taken if [schools are] found guilty," said Education Minister GSM Hayer.

309.title: Sniffer dog of MP police stolen by 4 people from backside of temple
309.article_body: A sniffer dog of Madhya Pradesh police was stolen from tourist town Orchha, police said on Sunday. Four persons travelling in an SUV took the dog away from the backside of a temple after it ran away in panic due to the bursting of firecrackers from its handler, an official said quoting the complaint.

310.title: 61-yr-old Sean, 30-yr-old Leila finalise divorce two years after 'COVID wedding'
310.article_body: Hollywood's 61-year-old actor Sean Penn and 30-year-old actress Leila George have finalised their divorce almost two years after getting married in July 2020. A month after their marriage, Penn appeared on a talk show and said that the couple had a "COVID wedding". "It was a county commissioner on Zoom and we were at the house," Penn had said.

311.title: Ukraine war indicates fossil fuel dependency not sustainable: EU chief
311.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on her visit to India said, "In Europe, Russia's war in Ukraine [is] a stark reminder that our dependency on Russian fossil fuels isn't sustainable." She added, "Our transition to home-grown energy is also an investment in our security." The EU Commission will present next month a new solar strategy under RePowerEU.

312.title: Europe needs to work with India to combat climate change: EU chief
312.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen, who's on a two-day visit to India, said on Sunday that Europe needs to work with India to combat climate change. She added that while Europe is on path to climate neutrality with 'EU green deal', saving the planet is a global effort. "We count on...young people, to keep fighting for...climate," she added.

313.title: Oman secures release of 14 foreigners held by Yemen's Houthi rebels
313.article_body: Oman's Foreign Ministry on Sunday tweeted that it had facilitated the release of 14 foreigners who were held by Houthi rebels in Yemen. They were transferred from Yemen's Sanaa to Muscat, it added. The people freed included a British man, his wife and child, seven Indian nationals, a Filipino, an Indonesian, an Ethiopian and a Myanmar national, it further said.

314.title: 10 more Shiv Sena workers arrested for ruckus outside BJP MP's house
314.article_body: Khar Police on Sunday arrested 10 more Shiv Sena workers for allegedly creating a ruckus outside BJP MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's house in Mumbai. "A total of 16 workers have been arrested...Police will present everyone in the court [on Monday]," Mumbai Police said. Both Ravi and Navneet have been sent to 14-days judicial custody.

315.title: India's oil imports nearly double to $119.2 billion in FY22
315.article_body: India imported 212.2 million tonnes of crude oil, worth $119.2 billion, in the fiscal year that ended on March 31, Petroleum Ministry's data showed. This is nearly double the $62.2 billion that India spent on 196.5 million tonnes of oil in the previous fiscal. India bought $13.7 billion-oil in March alone, when oil prices surged to 14-year high.

316.title: Barmy Army share pic of Sachin's dismissal in birthday post, fans react
316.article_body: England's Barmy Army took to social media to share a picture of Sachin Tendulkar's dismissal while wishing him on his birthday. "Why this pic?" a fan commented on the post. "A lion against a pack of wolves...that's what I see," another wrote. Other comments read, "[They] willingly selected this image" and "This won't give England an Ashes series victory."

317.title: Bill Murray accused of inappropriate behaviour on 'Being Mortal' set: Report
317.article_body: The shooting of 'Being Mortal' which stars Bill Murray, Aziz Ansari and Seth Rogan has been suspended over Bill's "inappropriate behaviour." As per Page Six, some women felt uncomfortable and he crossed a line after being "very hands-on touchy". The 71-year-old had reportedly put an arm around a woman, touched her hair and pulled her ponytail in a "comedic way".

318.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif to visit Saudi Arabia on April 27: Reports
318.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif is likely to visit Saudi Arabia on April 27, local media has reported. This comes after names of several politicians, including PM Sharif, were removed from country's Exit Control List (ECL). The ECL is an ordinance to provide for the control of exit of certain persons from Pakistan who have been involved in any economic offence.

319.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi railway godown, 14 fire engines reach spot
319.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a godown in Sabzi Mandi railway station in Delhi on Sunday. A total of 14 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. A video that has surfaced online shows trains being present at the station at the time of the incident, while the area was covered with smoke.

320.title: We didn't say Kerala govt officials had come to Delhi: AAP's Atishi
320.article_body:
AAP MLA Atishi replied after Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty questioned her claim that Delhi government hosted Kerala officials who wanted to study Delhi education model. Atishi said, "I would like to request Kerala Education Minister to check facts before tweeting." 
"We didn't say...Kerala government officials had come to Delhi. Kerala CBSE school management officials had come," she said.

321.title: Crypto profits grew 400% in 2021 to $162.7 bn: Chainalysis
321.article_body: Crypto investors gained a total of $162.7 billion in 2021, a 400% increase from just $32.5 billion in 2020, a report by data analytics firm Chainalysis revealed. As per the report, the US investors profited the most (around $47 billion), followed by the UK, Germany and China. India came 21st, with $1.85 billion in total realised gains, the report added.

322.title: Trans people can register themselves, avail benefits: UP govt plan
322.article_body: The Social Welfare Ministry of Uttar Pradesh has proposed a first of its kind voluntary registration for transgender people in the state, aimed at formulating welfare measures for the community, according to reports. The ministry has proposed a budget of ₹200 crore for the welfare of transgenders by means of providing them with education facilities, providing basic amenities and more.

323.title: Religare Enterprises resolves all legacy issues with SEBI
323.article_body: Religare Enterprises Limited (REL) on Sunday said it has resolved all legacy issues with market regulator SEBI. REL said the overlooked compliance requirements pointed out by SEBI took place when the firm's control and management rested with former promoters Malvinder and Shivinder Mohan Singh. "The erstwhile promoters have already been reclassified as public shareholders," REL added.

324.title: New Pakistani govt removes PM Shehbaz Sharif from no-fly list
324.article_body: Pakistan's new government has amended rules pertaining to the Exit Control List (ECL),  dealing with people not allowed to leave the country. PM Shehbaz Sharif, his niece Maryam Nawaz Sharif, ex-PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi and Finance Minister Miftah Ismail were among the people removed from the list. Around 3,000 people have benefitted due to the changes, the Interior Minister said.

325.title: Doing a remake of a film has its pros and cons: Janhvi Kapoor
325.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor in an interview has stated that doing a remake of a film has its pros and cons, adding that you know it's a film that has been loved by a large group of people. "It is a fun balance between still respecting the material and the intention with which the material was made," the actress added.

326.title: Dad Shammi Kapoor didn't tell us before marrying Neila Devi: Son
326.article_body: Late veteran actor Shammi Kapoor's son Aditya has revealed that his father didn't tell him or his sister before marrying second wife Neila Devi. Aditya added that he was 13 years old and at his aunt's place at the time. "He married in the morning...When I met him in the evening, he told me...Neila Devi is my mother," Aditya added.

327.title: Arjun wishes Varun on his b'day with an 'Andaz Apna Apna' dialogue
327.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a video of Varun Dhawan on his 35th birthday on Instagram. Varun called Arjun a 'lady killer' in the video. Quoting a line from the 1994 film 'Andaz Apna Apna', Arjun wrote, "Yeh Aadmi purush hi nahi mahapurush hai (He's not just a man but a great man)...You predicted me being a Lady Killer in 2015!"

328.title: Didn't want to be just R Madhavan's son: Vedaant after winning Danish Open gold
328.article_body: Vedaant Madhavan, who recently won a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022 in Copenhagen, said in an interview with DD News that he wants to make a name for himself. "I didn't wanna live under my dad's shadow...I didn't want to be just (actor) R Madhavan's son," said the teenager.

329.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K
329.article_body: At least three Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists were killed by security forces during an encounter in Pahoo area of Pulwama district in Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday. The terrorists fired upon the security personnel, who retaliated. On Saturday, two Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorists were killed during the encounter in the Mirhama area.

330.title: US Prez Biden marks 'Armenian genocide', vows to 'stop atrocities'
330.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday commemorated the 107th anniversary of the start of the 'Armenian genocide'. "We recommit ourselves to speaking out and stopping atrocities that leave lasting scars on the world,” Biden said. The 'genocide' refers to the time period in 1915 when an estimated 1.5 million Christian Armenians were massacred, expelled from erstwhile Ottoman Empire (present-day Turkey).

331.title: Moving on from making fun of Bill Gates for shorting Tesla: Musk
331.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Moving on..." After several Twitter users began guessing that Musk is moving on from his desire to buy Twitter, Musk tweeted, "(from making fun of Gates for shorting Tesla while claiming to support climate change action)". Earlier, Musk admitted to confronting Bill Gates on shorting Tesla stock.

332.title: My hero: Sambha actor Mac Mohan's daughter on his birth anniversary
332.article_body: Late actor Mac Mohan's daughter Vinati Makijany penned a note for him on his birth anniversary on social media, writing, "Happy Birthday my HERO. They don't make them like you anymore Papa." The actor was known for portraying the role of Sambha in 1975 film 'Sholay'. Vinati further wrote, "I wish I could hold you just one more time."

333.title: Chinese authorities erect fences outside Shanghai's COVID-hit areas
333.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai have erected fences outside residential buildings in an effort to impose a COVID-19 lockdown. China has imposed strict lockdowns in response to outbreaks as part of its 'zero-COVID' policy. "This is so disrespectful of the rights of...people inside, using metal barriers to enclose them like domestic animals," a Chinese social media user said on Weibo.

334.title: CBI arrests 3 more in gang-rape, murder of minor girl in WB's Nadia
334.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation arrested three more accused of the alleged gang-rape and murder of a minor girl in West Bengal's Nadia district. "During the course of the investigation, the role of the said accused has allegedly been found and, accordingly, they have been arrested," read a statement. She was allegedly raped on April 4 at a birthday party.

335.title: KL Rahul becomes second Indian to slam 4 hundreds in IPL
335.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul has become the second Indian batter after Virat Kohli to slam four hundreds in IPL. The 30-year-old smashed his fourth hundred in IPL off 61 deliveries against MI on Sunday. It is Rahul's second hundred in IPL 2022, with both the hundreds coming against MI. Notably, Kohli has hit five hundreds in IPL.

336.title: UPI server faces outage, users from across India complain of failed payments
336.article_body: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) server appeared to be down for more than an hour on Sunday evening, causing disruptions in payments across India. Several users took to Twitter to complain about failed payments on major UPI apps, including PhonePe, Google Pay and Paytm. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is yet to issue a statement on the outage.

337.title: FM Sitharaman urges Indian diaspora to become partners in growth
337.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday urged the Indian diaspora to become partners in India's growth in the next 25 years. Addressing the Indian community in Silicon Valley, San Francisco Bay Area, Sitharaman spoke about structural reforms undertaken by the Centre. She also highlighted the stellar contributions of Indian diaspora in US, especially their role in innovation and research.

338.title: Your performance in 'KGF 2' was just mind-blowing: Ram Charan to Yash
338.article_body: Actor Ram Charan, taking to Twitter, congratulated the makers of 'KGF: Chapter 2' for the success of their film and praised actor Yash for his performance in the film. "CONGRATULATIONS to my brother Prashanth Neel...and the entire team for the massive success of 'KGF: Chapter 2'," he tweeted. "Rocky! Dear brother Yash, your performance was just mind-blowing," Ram further wrote.

339.title: Russia's flag carrier Aeroflot to resume Maldives flights from May 13
339.article_body: Russia's flag carrier Aeroflot will resume its flights to the Maldives from May 13, the Maldives Civil Aviation Authority said on Sunday. Aeroflot will operate one daily flight between the two countries, the aviation authority added. The move comes after Aeroflot suspended flights to the Maldives on March 8, following the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February.

340.title: Russia might mine Bitcoin amid sanctions to generate hard cash: IMF
340.article_body: Russia might sidestep Western sanctions by using its unwanted energy exports to mine Bitcoin to generate hard cash, IMF said in its recent Global Financial Stability Report. Russia could also use crypto exchanges that don't comply with the sanctions to carry out transactions, the report added. It urged countries to consider amending laws to take crypto assets into account.

341.title: SC grants bail to Bihar woman whose cousin drove her scooty with liquor
341.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted anticipatory bail to a woman from Patna who was booked after her cousin was found driving her scooty with nine liquor bottles. The 21-year-old woman was booked under the prohibition law. The court said, "The scooty, though belonging to her, was not being driven by her at the relevant point of time."

342.title: Top US officials to visit Kyiv to discuss supply of arms: Zelenskyy
342.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin will visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Sunday. Blinken and Austin will be the most senior US officials to visit the country since the start of the invasion on February 24. Ukraine's call for more powerful weapons will be discussed during the visit, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

343.title: Bus with 50 passengers overturns in Odisha, 25 injured
343.article_body: A bus carrying 50 passengers from Odisha's Puri to Tamil Nadu overturned on the highway near Rambha in the Ganjam district on Sunday leaving 25 people injured. Four of them survived major injuries, police said. The District Magistrate and Chhatrapur Sub-Collector visited the spot. Notably, a highway widening project is underway near the accident spot.

344.title: Hindus, Muslims organise 'Tiranga Yatra' in Jahangirpuri; call for peace
344.article_body: Hindus and Muslims of the riot-hit Jahangirpuri in Delhi took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Sunday to promote communal harmony. Around 50 people each from both sides took part in the procession amid heavy police deployment. The yatra started from Kusal Chowk and then moved towards Block B, BC market, mosque, temple, Bhumi Ghat and culminated at Azad Chowk.

345.title: Old video of 35,000 people singing Happy Birthday for Sachin during IPL goes viral
345.article_body: On the occasion of Sachin Tendulkar's birthday, an old video of thousands of people singing the birthday song for him has gone viral on Twitter. The video, shot during IPL 2018 in Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, shows Sachin smiling and covering his face as people sing 'Happy Birthday' for him. Tendulkar turns 49 today.

346.title: TCS could become the world's largest IT company: CEO
346.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services' (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said, "Absolutely. In many ways, we already are," when he was asked if the Indian IT services major could become the world's largest IT company. Gopinathan also said, "Today we are $25 billion in size...There is no reason we shouldn't aspire to be double, triple, quadruple of the size we are today."

347.title: Randeep Hooda shares 'Extraction' action sequence to mark 2 yrs
347.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda shared a video of an action sequence from the film 'Extraction' on social media to mark two years of its release on Sunday. He wrote in the caption, "That was fun. Wishing team #Extraction all the best for #Extraction2." Randeep had previously hurt his knee during the film's shoot for which he had to undergo surgery.

348.title: Two-thirds of all Android phones sold in 2021 put user privacy at risk: Report
348.article_body: Check Point Research claimed two-thirds of all Android phones sold in 2021 put the privacy of users at risk. Check Point discovered vulnerabilities in the ALAC audio coding format that could've led an attacker to remotely get access to media and audio conversations. "MediaTek and Qualcomm, two of the largest mobile chipset manufacturers, used ALAC in their handsets," it added.

349.title: Umran bowling yorkers at that pace makes him very dangerous: McGrath
349.article_body: Glenn McGrath, speaking about SRH pacer Umran Malik, has said, "If you have a bowler bowling at that pace, I'm sure the selectors will be very interested." McGrath added, "Bowling...yorker is a lot tougher...the fact...he's able to bowl one at that pace makes him very dangerous." Umran has taken 10 wickets in seven matches so far in IPL 2022.

350.title: Will issue COVID-19 guidelines after meeting with PM Modi: Bommai
