350.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government will issue COVID-19 guidelines after a video conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on April 27 regarding the ongoing situation. "The central government has given instructions to take precautions regarding COVID-19. Scientists are doing research on COVID-19 variants...People must take precautions," Bommai added.

351.title: MRI machine sucks oxygen cylinder at MP hospital, no one injured
351.article_body: Staff at Shalby Hospital in MP's Indore managed to avert a mishap after the MRI machine sucked an oxygen cylinder while a patient was being shifted on a stretcher. "The staff turned the machine off immediately," staff members said, adding the patient wasn't injured. According to staff, the ward boy had allegedly forgotten to remove the cylinder from the stretcher.

352.title: Rishabh Pant is showing glimpses of MS Dhoni behind the stump: Kuldeep
352.article_body: Delhi Capitals spinner Kuldeep Yadav said Rishabh Pant is showing glimpses of former India captain MS Dhoni behind the stumps. "Pant guides well...stays calm on the field," Kuldeep added. "Wicketkeepers play...big role in the success of spinners...credit for my performance in IPL 2022 goes to Pant as well," he stated. Kuldeep has taken 13 wickets in seven matches so far.

353.title: Incidents of violence in country systematic conspiracy of BJP: Chavan
353.article_body: Former Chief Minister of Maharashtra Prithviraj Chavan on Sunday said that the incidents of violence in the country are a systematic conspiracy of the BJP. "The BJP is deliberately trying to disrupt law and order. No protests are reported from the senior level of the BJP. This means that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has tacitly agreed to it," he said.

354.title: Ukraine seeks equipment from IAEA to keep running nuclear plants
354.article_body: Ukraine has submitted a list of equipment to the International Atomic Energy Agency that it needs to operate nuclear power plants, IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said. This includes radiation measurement devices, protective material, computer-related assistance, power supply systems and diesel generators, he added. Grossi is due to visit the defunct Chornobyl nuclear plant next week.

355.title: Gujarat Cong leader Gadhvi joins AAP, says 'starting new inning'
355.article_body: Gujarat Congress leader Kailash Gadhvi joined Aam Aadmi Party in Ahmedabad on Sunday. Addressing the media at the party office, he said, "Today, I'm starting a new inning", adding, "I'm not here to talk about old things but talk about a new Gujarat". Gadhvi had earlier met AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal and said he'll join the party with 300 supporters.

356.title: Delhi sees over 1,000 new COVID-19 cases for 3rd straight day, 1 death recorded
356.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 1,083 new COVID-19 cases, marking the third consecutive day with over 1,000 new cases. One related death and 812 recoveries were also recorded in Delhi on Sunday. The national capital's daily positivity rate came down slightly from Saturday's 4.8% to 4.48% on Sunday.

357.title: T'gana only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists: TRS MLC
357.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Sunday said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao had allotted ₹100 crore for the welfare of journalists in Telangana, adding that it's the only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists. She stated that ₹1 lakh will be given to families of deceased journalists. Additionally, their kin will receive a ₹3,000 pension for five years.

358.title: B'luru is the identity of youth of India: PM on Khelo India games
358.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of the inauguration of Khelo India University Games in Bengaluru said the city is the identity of India's youth. "The organisation of the Khelo India University Games in Bengaluru will add to the energy of this beautiful city," he added. PM Modi said first mantra to be successful in sports is team spirit.

359.title: KCR ropes in Prashant Kishor's I-PAC to campaign for 2023 T'gana polls
359.article_body: CM K Chandrashekar Rao's Telangana Rashtra Samithi has roped in political strategist Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign for the 2023 state polls, party leader KT Rama Rao said. "I-PAC is working for us officially. We aren't working with Prashant Kishor but we are working with I-PAC," he added. This comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress.

360.title: Hashtags don't really help posts get more views: Instagram chief
360.article_body: Adding hashtags to Instagram posts does not help in increasing the posts' views, the social media platform's chief Adam Mosseri said. Responding to an Instagram user when he was asked if "hashtags help views", Mosseri said, "I wouldn’t...think of hashtags as a way to...get more distribution." He added that hashtags help Instagram's algorithm in understanding what the post is about.

361.title: BJP govt doing whatever they want, killing democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
361.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday met the family of the female Inspector who died by suicide in Amethi and said that police are taking such steps because they have to work under pressure. "Yogi Adityanath government is doing whatever they want and killing democracy," he said, adding that SP will raise the matter in the upcoming Assembly session.

362.title: 100-yr-old Brazilian man works at same firm for 84 years, sets world record
362.article_body: A 100-year-old Brazilian man entered the Guinness World Record book for working for the longest time at the same company. Walter Orthmann started on the factory floor of a company, which is now known as RenauxView, 84 years ago and continues to work there. "You can't just do any job to say that you're working. That doesn't work," Orthmann said.

363.title: At least spare the dead: Cong to Rana Kapoor for allegations on Patel, Deora
363.article_body: Congress termed Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor's allegations against late leaders Murli Deora and Ahmed Patel, and party leader, Priyanka Gandhi, "political vendetta". "At least spare the dead," Congress said. Kapoor alleged he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka for ₹2 crore for funding Sonia's treatment and Patel told him, "You're (Kapoor) doing a good deed".

364.title: Mahindra tags Elon Musk in tweet calling Indian bullock cart 'original Tesla'
364.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted a message on the Indian bullock cart, which called the latter the "original Tesla vehicle". "No Google Map required, no fuel to buy, no pollution, fully self-driven...relax, take a nap, reach your destination," said the message. "Back to the future," said Mahindra, while tagging Tesla CEO Elon Musk in the tweet.

365.title: I've become increasingly indifferent to social media trolling: Janhvi
365.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about social media trolling, has said, "I have become increasingly indifferent to it." "But time and again...I'm always a little surprised...by just the double standards sometimes. And how bitter some people can be, but...it's not a big deal," she further said. On the work front, Janhvi will next be seen in 'Good Luck Jerry'.

366.title: Women's Commission can't issue notice to Chandrababu Naidu: TDP
366.article_body: Telugu Desam Party's (TDP) Varla Ramaiah has claimed that Andhra Pradesh Women's Commission chairperson Vasireddy Padma doesn't have authority to issue notices to Chandrababu Naidu and ex-party MLA Bonda Uma. The commission issued notices after Padma accused Naidu of outraging her modesty and insulting her at a Vijayawada government hospital. They had assembled there to meet a gangrape survivor.

367.title: 10 of 26 people from missing Japanese boat confirmed dead
367.article_body: Authorities in Japan on Sunday announced the death of 10 people who were found by rescuers after a tour boat they were on went missing on Saturday. There were 26 people, including two children and two crew members, on the boat when it sent a distress signal. The authorities have continued their search for the remaining 16 people.

368.title: 'Pushpa 2' will have too many catchy lines: Dialogue writer Vissa
368.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' dialogue writer Srikanth Vissa has said the audience will witness too many catchy lines in the sequel to the 2021 film. "In 'Pushpa: The Rise' it worked, in the second part, we are expecting it to be bigger and better," he stated. "There's unbelievable pressure. We have to exceed the expectations and work towards it," he added.

369.title: PM Modi receives the first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award
369.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday received the first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award. April 24 marks the 80th death anniversary of Master Deenanath Mangeshkar, the late singing legend Lata Mangeshkar's father. "When the award is in the name of an elder sister...like Lata Didi, it's a symbol of her...love for me...It's not possible for me not to accept," PM said.

370.title: 17 lakh Indians contracted HIV in last 10 yrs due to unprotected sex
370.article_body: More than 17 lakh people contracted HIV in the country in the last 10 years due to unprotected intercourse, according to the data from the National Aids Control Organization. However, there has also been a declining trend in such HIV cases during the decade. The highest number of such cases were reported in Andhra Pradesh at 3,18,814.

371.title: KKR are good enough to be in IPL 2022 playoffs: Head coach McCullum
371.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has said that his team is good enough to enter the playoffs of IPL 2022. This comes after KKR have lost four consecutive matches in the ongoing tournament and are placed seventh on the points table. "We'll just keep working hard...hopefully, things will work out," he added. KKR will next face DC on April 28.

372.title: MI to bowl first against LSG in their first match at Wankhede since 2019
372.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. MI are playing at the Wankhede Stadium for the first time since May 5, 2019. MI are fielding the same playing XI, while Mohsin Khan has replaced Avesh Khan in LSG's playing XI.

373.title: Twitter bans misleading ads contradicting climate change science
373.article_body: Twitter announced on Earth Day that it is banning misleading advertisements that go against the scientific consensus on climate change from its platform. "We believe that climate denialism shouldn't be monetised on Twitter," the micro-blogging site stated. The announcement, however, didn't indicate if the change would affect what users post on the micro-blogging site.

374.title: Guinea's ousted Prez Conde freed from house arrest after 7 months
374.article_body: Ex-Guinea President Alpha Conde has been freed from house arrest seven months after he was ousted from power by a military coup, country's interim government said on Friday. Conde, 84, is now allowed to receive visitors, including family members. Conde, who became Guinea's first democratically-elected president in 2010, was overthrown in September 2021 on allegations of fostering state corruption.

375.title: Mumbai lawyer, associate held for trying to extort ₹4cr from a developer
375.article_body: Two people, including a lawyer, have been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly trying to extort ₹4 crore from a developer, who is executing a project in Panchsheel Nagar in Chembur. Some of the tenants had filed a complaint against him and were demanding money to withdraw it. The developer approached the Mumbai Crime Branch and the arrests were made subsequently.

376.title: Anurag Thakur inaugurates Khelo India University Games in B'luru
376.article_body: Union Youth Affairs and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday inaugurated the first edition of the Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru. "I'm confident that you'll see a lot of the participants of Khelo India University Games 2021 representing India at the international level," Thakur said. A light and sound show was also organised at the ceremony.

377.title: Felt humiliated when Hindi cinema was shown as Indian cinema at event: Chiranjeevi
377.article_body: Chiranjeevi revealed that he felt "very humiliated" and 'insulted' when at a pre-award ceremony government function in Delhi, South Indian film stars and filmmakers weren't given space on a wall portraying Indian cinema. Talking about the 1989 event, Chiranjeevi said, "They portrayed Hindi cinema as Indian cinema. While other films were categorised as 'regional films' and were not given respect."

378.title: Complete breakdown of law & order: Chidambaram on bulldozer demolitions
378.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that the recent bulldozer-enabled demolitions reflect a "complete breakdown of law and order", alleging that the method of removing encroachments is aimed at Muslims and the poor. He further said that the BJP leaders' justification of bulldozer-enabled demolitions "flies in the face of the law."

379.title: Going forward Babar Azam will be among legends of cricket: Harbhajan
379.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan has said that it's too early to place Pakistan skipper Babar Azam in the 'Fab Four'. "But Babar has the quality, he is a proper batsman with so much confidence...technique. Going forward he will be one of the legends of cricket," Harbhajan added. Virat Kohli, Joe Root, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson are considered the 'Fab Four'.

380.title: LPU faculty member 'insults' Lord Ram, says he's not a good person; sacked
380.article_body: Lovely Professional University (LPU) has sacked a member of its teaching faculty after a video surfaced online in which she is allegedly seen insulting the Hindu god Ram. "Actually, Ram is not a good person by heart. Ram is not a good person at all. Ravana is a good person. I find Ram is a cunning person," the woman said.

381.title: Dogecoin payment sent over 160 km without using internet for the first time
381.article_body: A Dogecoin developer has successfully conducted the first Dogecoin payment without using the internet through a protocol called 'RadioDoge'. The developer tweeted that 4.2069 Dogecoin was sent over 160 km using libdogecoin, a programming library for creating Dogecoin projects, and radio. They added that the recipient used Starlink satellite network to relay the transfer to the Dogecoin mainnet.

382.title: Massive fire breaks out at a garage in Kolkata; no one injured
382.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a garage on Tangra Christopher Road in central Kolkata at around 3 pm on Sunday, officials said. No one was injured in the blaze, they added. Eight fire tenders were sent to the spot to douse the blaze, they said, adding that the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.

383.title: Mahira Sharma walks out of interview over 'bodyshaming' question
383.article_body: Mahira Sharma, known for participating in 'Bigg Boss 13', walked out of an interview. The now-deleted viral video showed the host introducing her saying, "Sometimes people call you fat, sometimes they say you're too skinny and a similar thing has been happening with her of late." Mahira interrupted the host saying, "It is not a good question," before walking out.

384.title: Cong extorts money from powerful people: Malviya on painting issue
384.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya has accused Congress of "extorting" money from people in positions of power. He alleged that Congress was selling India's highest civilian honour. Malviya's remarks came after Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor told ED he was compelled to buy MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi at ₹2 crore, adding that he wouldn't be considered for Padma Bhushan otherwise.

385.title: 5 members of a family get life term for killing 3 in Gurugram
385.article_body: Five members of a family were sentenced to life imprisonment by a Gurugram court on Friday for beating three of their neighbours, a woman and her two sons, to death during a quarrel. The judge also asked the convicts to pay a fine of ₹65,000 each. The quarrel had started over construction material kept in front of convicts' house.

386.title: Police allowed attack under MVA govt pressure: Fadnavis on Somaiya attack
386.article_body: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that police allowed Shiv Sena workers to carry it out under the pressure of the Maha Vikas Aghadi government. Maharashtra BJP president Chandrakant Patil alleged that the MVA government is doing violence with the help of police.

387.title: Improper to name airport after me: Yediyurappa to K'taka CM
387.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Sunday said he felt that naming the under-construction airport at Shivamogga after him is "not a proper decision". In a letter to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, Yediyurappa said, "I express my gratitude...[but] request you to revisit the decision." Bommai said the airport will be ready for inauguration in December this year.

388.title: World's top palm oil producer Indonesia bans exports
388.article_body: Indonesia, which is the world's top palm oil producer, announced plans to ban palm oil exports from April 28 amid a record rise in global food inflation. President Joko Widodo said he wanted to ensure that the availability of cooking oil was "abundant" and "affordable" in Indonesia. As per Solvent Extractors' Association Of India (SEA), this will hurt Indian consumers.

389.title: Alia & Ranbir's first pic together from a screen test 18 years ago goes viral
389.article_body: After Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor got married, a picture of the couple from 18 years ago has gone viral online. The black-and-white picture is reportedly their first together and was taken during a screen test when Alia was 11 and Ranbir was around 20 years old. The couple has reportedly made the framed picture a part of their home.

390.title: How about declaring April 24 as National Cricket Day: Kaif on Sachin's birthday
390.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to wish Sachin Tendulkar on his 49th birthday. He wrote, "How about declaring April 24 as National Cricket Day. I have never seen anybody so madly in love with the game like Sachin Paaji." He added, "Happy Birthday to the man who played a big role in India's amar prem with cricket."

391.title: Just like there was one Lata didi, there's one Remo D'Souza: Asha Bhosle
391.article_body: Singer Asha Bhosle made a guest appearance on dance reality show 'Dance India Dance L'il Masters'. She said, "I've been a huge fan of Remo (D'Souza)...I'm so glad [I got] this opportunity to meet my favorite choreographer." She further said that just like there was only one Lata Mangeshkar, there is just one dancer in the industry and that's Remo.

392.title: Indian oil firms saw 3.6 lakh cyberattacks in 6 months: Study
392.article_body: Indian oil companies faced 3.6 lakh cyberattacks between October 2021 and April 12, a study by civil society organisation CyberPeace Foundation revealed. One of the most recent and noticeable among these attacks was detected at Oil India Limited's (OIL) Assam headquarters this month, in which hackers reportedly demanded ₹57 crore. October saw the highest number of attacks at 1,17,633.

393.title: No, I was not named after Urmila's character in 'Judaai': Janhvi
393.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor told Filmfare that her parents, Boney Kapoor and late Sridevi Kapoor, didn't name her after actress Urmila Matondkar's character in 'Judaai'. "I think dad just really liked the name from before the film and mom did too," said Janhvi. "I think mom was really obsessed with the idea that the meaning of it was purity," she added.

394.title: You won't face problems your parents faced: PM to Kashmiri youth
394.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Sunday assured the youth that they won't face problems their parents witnessed. "The youth of the Valley, your father and mother, your dada and dadi...lived a life of trouble...you won't live such a life," he said. PM Modi inaugurated and laid foundation stones of projects worth around ₹20,000 crore.

395.title: Bayern Munich win 10th straight Bundesliga title after beating Dortmund
395.article_body: Bayern Munich defeated Borussia Dortmund 3-1 on Saturday to win their 10th consecutive Bundesliga title. They have accumulated 75 points on the Bundesliga points table with 24 victories, three draws and four losses. They won the title with three matches to spare. Bayern Munich have now won 32 German top-flight championships.

396.title: Amber is terrible, she used womanhood to play victim: Ireland Baldwin
396.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin's daughter Ireland Baldwin took to Instagram and defended Johnny Depp amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Reacting to the audio note played in the court in which Heard admitted to hitting Johnny, Ireland wrote, "I know women who are...like this. They're manipulative...they use their very womanhood to play the victim...Heard is a terrible person."

397.title: PM urges people to try 'Cashless Day Out' using only digital mode for payments
397.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has urged people to try a 'Cashless Day Out' by using only digital mode for payments. He gave an example of two girls from Delhi who spent an entire day roaming the city without doing any money transactions in cash. He said that people in small towns and in most villages are also transacting through UPI itself.

398.title: Felt humiliated when Hindi films shown as Indian cinema: Chiranjeevi
398.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi recalled an incident that took place when he was called to New Delhi after his 1988 film 'Rudra Veena' was being honoured with the Nargis Dutt Award. He stated that Hindi cinema was portrayed as Indian cinema. "I felt very humiliated...It was like an insult...other films were categorised as 'regional films' and were not given respect," he added.

399.title: UN chief Guterres to visit Turkey ahead of Moscow, Kyiv trips
399.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres will visit Turkey's capital Ankara on Monday before heading onward to Moscow and Kyiv next week for talks, a UN statement said on Saturday. Guterres' visit to Turkey comes as the country seeks to mediate the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, a negotiation meeting between Russian and Ukrainian delegations was also held in Turkey last month.

400.title: Kolkata Police constable arrested for molesting minor girl in auto-rickshaw
400.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly molesting a minor girl in Kolkata. According to the girl's mother, the accused constable touched her daughter inappropriately while travelling in an auto-rickshaw. The woman claimed that when her daughter told her about the incident, she asked the auto-rickshaw driver to go to the nearest police station. The driver did as told.
